translated: “The lineage of the Tathagatas is produced” means that the lineage of the Tathagatas is generated.

original: zhing ni thams cad mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: zhing ni thams cad mtha' yas pa //
translated: The field is all the infinite worlds.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nam mkha'i khams thams cad dang 'dra bar mtha' yas shing rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing nam mkha'i khams thams cad dang 'dra bar mtha' yas shing rgya che ba'o //
translated: The Buddha-field is like the whole realm of space, infinite and vast.

original: de nyid ni 'jig rten thams cad do //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'jig rten thams cad do //
translated: That itself is all the worlds.

original: khams bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de rnams nyid nas sa 'og dang sa bla dang lha yul gyi rang bzhin can /🔽mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gsum po gang yin pa ni 'jig rten thams cad de ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig tu gnas pas na /
analyzed: khams bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de rnams nyid nas sa 'og dang sa bla dang lha yul gyi rang bzhin can / mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gsum po gang yin pa ni 'jig rten thams cad de ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig tu gnas pas na /
translated: The worlds together with their realms are the three infinite worlds of the hells, ghosts, animals, gods, and humans, which are the Buddha-fields.

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang khams thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang khams thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: All the worlds together with their realms are called all the worlds and all the realms because they are the infinite realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas thams cad kyis //
translated: At that time, all the Buddhas

original: til gyi gong bu bzhin du gang //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: til gyi gong bu bzhin du gang //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
translated: are like sesame seeds in a pod.

original: zhing khams thams cad dang ji skad du bshad pa'i 'jig rten thams cad khams dang bcas pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs bskyed par bya bas na /
analyzed: zhing khams thams cad dang ji skad du bshad pa'i 'jig rten thams cad khams dang bcas pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs bskyed par bya bas na /
translated: All the buddhafields and all the worlds as explained, together with their constituent elements, are all pervaded by the family of all the Tathagatas.

original: dper na til gyi gong bul til gyi sa bon gyis bar mtshams med par yongs su gang ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i zhing thams cad dang / khams dang bcas pa'i @267a * //
analyzed: dper na til gyi gong bul til gyi sa bon gyis bar mtshams med par yongs su gang ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i zhing thams cad dang / khams dang bcas pa'i @267a * //
translated: Just as a sesame seed is pervaded by its oil, so all the worlds are pervaded by the dust-mote-sized buddhafields, together with their constituent elements.

original: 'jig rten thams cad rnam par snad mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dus de'i tshe myur zhing rengs par yongs su gang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad rnam par snad mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis dus de'i tshe myur zhing rengs par yongs su gang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the worlds are pervaded by all the Buddhas, Vairocana and so forth, at that time, quickly and completely.

original: 'jig rten khams ni thams cad na //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams ni thams cad na //
translated: In all the world systems

original: sems can kun mdun yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: sems can kun mdun yang dag bzhugs //
translated: they sit in front of all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba 'di na sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa yongs su gang ba mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas dang bcas pa dang / sangs rgyas med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la re re'i yang mdun na bzhugs par snang bas /🔽sems can kun mdun yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di na sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas pa yongs su gang ba mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas dang bcas pa dang / sangs rgyas med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la re re'i yang mdun na bzhugs par snang bas / sems can kun mdun yang dag bzhugs //
translated: The buddhas appear to be present in the world-realms, both those that have buddhas and those that do not, in front of all sentient beings belonging to the six life-forms.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are present in front of all sentient beings.

original: ci zhig gi don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi don du zhe na /
translated: For whose sake?

original: sems can thams cad rnam dag phyir //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rnam dag phyir // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: For the sake of the purification of all sentient beings.

original: sems can yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: sems can yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na sems can thams cad do //
translated: Since they are sentient beings and all of them, they are all sentient beings.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byas pas nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon sum du byas pas nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: Their purification is their freedom from the stain of the afflictions together with their propensities, through the realization of unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de'i don du sems can thams cad kyi mdun na bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i don du sems can thams cad kyi mdun na bzhugs so //
translated: For that sake, they are present in front of all sentient beings.

original: sems can de dag thams cad de rnams bzhugs pas yang dag par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems can de dag thams cad de rnams bzhugs pas yang dag par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Are all those sentient beings purified by their presence or not?

original: rang gi las kyis dag ma gyur //
analyzed: rang gi las kyis dag ma gyur //
translated: They are not purified by their karma.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i rang gi las la 'jug pa gang yin pas sems can de dag thams cad dag par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i rang gi las la 'jug pa gang yin pas sems can de dag thams cad dag par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those sentient beings are not purified by the karma of their own engagement in the abandonment of the holy Dharma, etc.

original: sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du byas par ma gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du byas par ma gyur to //
translated: They do not manifest Buddhahood.

original: de'i tshe ni de'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time, at that occasion,

original: de rnams ni 'dus par mdzad de ;
analyzed: de rnams ni 'dus par mdzad de ;
translated: they assemble

original: sems can thams cad kyi mdun du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mdun du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad do //
translated: all the Buddhas who are present before all sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi khams gso dka' ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams gso dka' ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the realm of sentient beings difficult to cure?

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that it is by nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin te /
translated: Nature is one’s own essence.

original: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i las kyis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi snod du ma gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i las kyis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi snod du ma gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is not a vessel of Buddha enlightenment by the karma of engagement in the abandonment of the holy Dharma, etc.

original: sems can gyi khams rnams rang bzhin gyis gso dka' ba des na /🔽rang gi las ni spyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnams rang bzhin gyis gso dka' ba des na / rang gi las ni spyang ba'i phyir /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is naturally difficult to heal.🔽Therefore,

original: btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa yin //
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa yin //
translated: the great equanimity is performed in order to purify their karma.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: rang gi yang yin la las kyang yin @267b bas rang gi las te /
analyzed: rang gi yang yin la las kyang yin @267b bas rang gi las te /
translated: Since it is one's own and also karma, it is one's own karma.

original: sems can de rnams kyi dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i las rnams so //🔽sbyang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skal ba med pa'i sems can de rnams kyi /
analyzed: sems can de rnams kyi dam pa'i chos spong ba la sogs pa'i las rnams so // sbyang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skal ba med pa'i sems can de rnams kyi /
translated: It refers to the karma of those sentient beings, such as abandoning the sublime Dharma.

original: sdig pa bsal ba'i don spyang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa bsal ba'i don spyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to purify means in order to remove the evil of those unfortunate sentient beings.

original: don de'i phyir sangs rgyas de dag thams cad btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: don de'i phyir sangs rgyas de dag thams cad btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa yin te /
translated: For that purpose, all those buddhas perform the great equanimity.

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can de rnams spyang ba'i phyir re zhig 'bad pa mi mdzad kyi /
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can de rnams spyang ba'i phyir re zhig 'bad pa mi mdzad kyi /
translated: In order to purify those unfortunate sentient beings, they do not exert themselves for the time being.

original: dus gzhan gyi tshe smin par bya ba'i sgo nas sems can gyi khams spyang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi tshe smin par bya ba'i sgo nas sems can gyi khams spyang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa yin no //
translated: and in other times, he thinks, “I will purify the realm of sentient beings by means of maturation,” and so he performs great equanimity.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su spyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su spyang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to purify all sentient beings as explained,

original: gang gi tshe mdun na bzhugs par gyur pas sems can gyi khams rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mdun na bzhugs par gyur pas sems can gyi khams rnams so //
translated: when he is present in front of the realm of sentient beings,

original: rnam par sbyong bar mdzad par mi spyod par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rnam par sbyong bar mdzad par mi spyod par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: he does not engage in purifying.

original: sems can gyi khams skal ba med pa na 'bad pa ni 'bras bu med par mkhyen na /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams skal ba med pa na 'bad pa ni 'bras bu med par mkhyen na /
translated: When he knows that the realm of sentient beings is without good fortune, and that effort is fruitless,

original: sangs rgyas de thams cad sems can thams cad spyang ba'i don du 'bad pa btang nas bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de thams cad sems can thams cad spyang ba'i don du 'bad pa btang nas bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: the Buddha, having given up effort for the sake of purifying all sentient beings, remains.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad btang snyoms chen po mdzad pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: Then, after all the Tathāgatas have performed great equanimity,

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, is Vajrasattva.

original: sems dpa' chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po bde ba che //
translated: The great being is of great bliss.

original: zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //🔽skad cig gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to // skad cig gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This has been explained.🔽In an instant means

original: skad cig ma gcig gis so //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis so //
translated: in one moment.

original: yang dag bskul zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad la sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag bskul zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad la sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is truly urged means the one who has become truly urged by all the buddhas to work for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: rdo rje can rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig skad cig gcig gis sangs rgyas thams cad yang dag par bskul zhe na /
analyzed: rdo rje can rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig skad cig gcig gis sangs rgyas thams cad yang dag par bskul zhe na /
translated: What kind of vajra-being is truly urged by all the buddhas in an instant?

original: byang chub chen por thugs brtan pas //
analyzed: byang chub chen por thugs brtan pas //
translated: The one whose mind is firm in great enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: byang chub kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas byang chub chen po ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas byang chub chen po ste /
translated: Since it is enlightenment and it is great, it is great enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: It is unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i rang bzhin yin pas na brtan zhing mi phyed pa'i thugs 'di la yod pas na byang chub chen por thugs brtan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yin pas na brtan zhing mi phyed pa'i thugs 'di la yod pas na byang chub chen por thugs brtan pa ste /
translated: Since it has the nature of that, it is the one whose mind is firm in great enlightenment, because it has an unbreakable mind.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje can gyis sangs rgyas thams cad skad cig gis yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa'o //🔽ji @268a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje can gyis sangs rgyas thams cad skad cig gis yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa'o // ji @268a * //
translated: Such a Vajra-holder instantly summons all the Buddhas.

original: ltar yang dag pa bskul zhe na /
analyzed: ltar yang dag pa bskul zhe na /
translated: How does he summon them?

original: sems can kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can kun la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “for the sake of the welfare of all sentient beings,” and so on.

original: sems can kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas sems can kun no //
analyzed: sems can kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas sems can kun no //
translated: Sentient beings are all, and they are all sentient beings.

original: de rnams la phan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bde ba'i las so //
analyzed: de rnams la phan pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bde ba'i las so //
translated: Their welfare is the activity of happiness in the future.

original: de nyid ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: de nyid ni bsod nams te /
translated: That itself is merit.

original: gtsang zhing dag par byed pas na bsod nams so //
analyzed: gtsang zhing dag par byed pas na bsod nams so //
translated: It is merit because it purifies and cleanses.

original: de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “the spirit of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas.”

original: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems ni byang chub sems so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems ni byang chub sems so //
translated: The spirit of enlightenment is the spirit that has the character of enlightenment.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid yin par ston to //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid yin par ston to //
translated: He shows that it is his own.

original: ci zhig tu rung ba zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig tu rung ba zhig gam 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Is it suitable or not?

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He says, “firmly established.”

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje mi shigs pa ni bdag nyid ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rdo rje mi shigs pa ni bdag nyid ston to //
translated: The vajra of suchness is indestructible, and it is taught to be the self.🔽Do not be indifferent!

original: shin tu btang snyoms ma mdzad cig / ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can kun la phan pa'i bsod nams byang chub kyi sems brtan zhing mi phyed pa dag yin pa des na sems can thams cad spyang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das btang snyoms
analyzed: shin tu btang snyoms ma mdzad cig / ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir sems can kun la phan pa'i bsod nams byang chub kyi sems brtan zhing mi phyed pa dag yin pa des na sems can thams cad spyang ba'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das btang snyoms
translated: Since they are the firm, indestructible thought of awakening, the merit that benefits all sentient beings, the Blessed Buddhas are not indifferent to the purification of all sentient beings.

original: ma mdzad cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ma mdzad cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyed rnams kyis btang snyoms mdzad na sems can rnams ngan 'gror 'gro bas sems can gyi khams brgyud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis btang snyoms mdzad na sems can rnams ngan 'gror 'gro bas sems can gyi khams brgyud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you were indifferent, sentient beings would go to the miserable realms, and the realm of sentient beings would continue.

original: de ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sangs rgyas thams cad sems can gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa dang / de rnams sems can gyi don gyi thabs ston cig ces sangs rgyas rnams kyis de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sangs rgyas thams cad sems can gyi don gyi phyir yang dag par bskul bar gyur pa dang / de rnams sems can gyi don gyi thabs ston cig ces sangs rgyas rnams kyis de skad du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when all the Buddhas, glorious Vajrasattva, were truly exhorted for the sake of sentient beings, the Buddhas said this: “You must teach the method for the benefit of sentient beings!”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag ston pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag ston pa'i tshig go //
translated: Then is the word of the teacher immediately following.

original: sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Buddha means the Tathagatas Vairocana and so forth.

original: gang gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang gsungs she na /
translated: What was said?

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje can //
translated: The one who has the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sku gsung thugs so //🔽de 'di la mnga' bas na sku gsung thugs rdo rje can te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni sku gsung thugs so // de 'di la mnga' bas na sku gsung thugs rdo rje can te /
translated: Body, speech, and mind are body, speech, and mind.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje dang ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje dang ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Since he has that, he is the one who has the vajra of body, speech, and mind, the Vajrasattva who has the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: ji ltar gsungs shing ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs shing ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: How was it said? What was said?

original: khyed ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyed ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, You are the one who has the mind of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub gyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub gyi mtshan nyid can gyi sems so //
translated: The mind of enlightenment is the mind that has the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: bdag ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the self?

original: thabs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thabs zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, the method.

original: @268b yid la mngon par 'dod cing bsam pa'i don bde bas thob par byed pas na thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @268b yid la mngon par 'dod cing bsam pa'i don bde bas thob par byed pas na thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “means” is that it is the means for attaining the desired and intended goal with ease.

original: gang gi thabs yin zhe na /🔽snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyi zhes ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi thabs yin zhe na / snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyi zhes ba gsungs te /
translated: Whose means?🔽The Bhagavān Buddhas, who are the nature of great compassion,

original: mi dmigs pa'i thugs rdo rje chen po'i rang bzhin can sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i thugs rdo rje chen po'i rang bzhin can sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi'o //
translated: who are the nature of the great vajra of non-apprehension.

original: khyed ces bya ba ni khyed nyid yin te gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyed ces bya ba ni khyed nyid yin te gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: “You” means you yourself, not another.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: This shows the following.

original: gang gi phyir khyed ni dmigs su med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can rnam par spyang ba'i thabs yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed ni dmigs su med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can rnam par spyang ba'i thabs yin la /
translated: Because you are the means for purifying sentient beings of the Bhagavān Buddhas, who are the nature of great compassion that is non-apprehensible,

original: de bas na sems can rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs khyed kyis smros shig ces de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems can rnam par sbyong ba'i thabs khyed kyis smros shig ces de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' la gsungs pa yin no //
translated: therefore the Tathāgatas say to the Bhagavān Vajrasattva, “Speak the means for purifying sentient beings.”

original: 'di ltar sems can gyi don gyi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis rdo rje 'chang la gsol ba btab pa dang / de mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gyi don gyi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis rdo rje 'chang la gsol ba btab pa dang / de mdzad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, all the Bhagavat Buddhas supplicate Vajradhara for the sake of sentient beings, and he performs that action.🔽Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: de nas ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Then the Teacher, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word then is as before.

original: ston pa rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ston pa rdo rje 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Teacher, Vajra Holder, has been explained.

original: de tshe kun nas byin gyis brlabs //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de tshe kun nas byin gyis brlabs // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He then blessed everything.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi khams gsum pa thams cad kun nas khyab par byin gyis brlabs pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi khams gsum pa thams cad kun nas khyab par byin gyis brlabs pas na /
translated: He blessed the entire realm of the mandala of the Tathagatas, pervading the entire triple world.

original: kun nas byin gyis brlabs pa ste de mdzad par gyur pas na /
analyzed: kun nas byin gyis brlabs pa ste de mdzad par gyur pas na /
translated: Therefore, he is called the blessed one, because he performs that action.

original: kun nas byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas byin gyis brlabs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He is called the blessed one,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i dus su de ltar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa'i dus su de ltar mdzad pa'o //
translated: because he performs that action at the time of being supplicated by all the Tathagatas.

original: ci zhig kun nas byin gyis brlabs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig kun nas byin gyis brlabs she na /
translated: What did he bless?

original: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The great bliss and so forth are mentioned.

original: bde ba chen po rdo rje zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The great bliss vajra is nondual intuition.

original: de las skyes pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is born from that, the tathāgata maṇḍala is called the great maṇḍala.

original: de nyid kyis na dam pa ste mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dam pa ste mchog go //
translated: It is excellent, that is, supreme, because of that.

original: de'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is its size?

original: khams gsum 'khor lo'i rgya khyon gyi //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: khams gsum 'khor lo'i rgya khyon gyi // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The extent of the three realm maṇḍala.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ni khams gsum gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ni khams gsum gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The desire, form, and formless realms are the three realm maṇḍala.

original: des khyab pa'i dang tshul 'di la yod pas na /
analyzed: des khyab pa'i dang tshul 'di la yod pas na /
translated: Since it exists in the manner of pervading that,

original: khams gsum gyi ni rgya khyon zhes bya'o //🔽'khor lo yang @269a * //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi ni rgya khyon zhes bya'o // 'khor lo yang @269a * //
translated: it is called the extent of the three realms.

original: yin pa chen po yang yin las na 'khor lo chen po ste /
analyzed: yin pa chen po yang yin las na 'khor lo chen po ste /
translated: It is a maṇḍala and it is great, thus it is a great maṇḍala,

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: which is the maṇḍala of Vairocana.

original: khams gsum 'khor lo'i rgya khyon yang yin la 'khor lo chen po yang yin pas na khams gsum pa'i rgya khyon gyi 'khor lo chen po'o //
analyzed: khams gsum 'khor lo'i rgya khyon yang yin la 'khor lo chen po yang yin pas na khams gsum pa'i rgya khyon gyi 'khor lo chen po'o //
translated: Since it is both the extent of the wheel of the three realms and also the great wheel, it is the great wheel of the extent of the three realms.

original: gdod nas byung zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis rtag tu bzhugs pas na gdod ma nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: gdod nas byung zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis rtag tu bzhugs pas na gdod ma nas byung ba'o //
translated: Since it exists as if it were present in the present, it is primordially arisen.

original: de yis khams gsum la gnas pa'i sems can rnams rab tu bsgrub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yis khams gsum la gnas pa'i sems can rnams rab tu bsgrub ces bya ba ni /
translated: By that, all sentient beings abiding in the three realms are fully accomplished.

original: khams gsum gyi 'khor lo'i rgya khyon can gyi rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor des /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'khor lo'i rgya khyon can gyi rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor des /
translated: The maṇḍala of Vairocana, who has the extent of the wheel of the three realms,

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa ste /
translated: is the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad bskal pa ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la mngon par 'dod cing brtson par rab tu bsgrubs te /
analyzed: khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad bskal pa ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la mngon par 'dod cing brtson par rab tu bsgrubs te /
translated: All sentient beings abiding in the three realms are fully accomplished in accordance with the eon, aspiring to and striving for the family of the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la rab tu gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa la sogs pa la rab tu gzhag pa'o //
translated: In order to realize the lineage of the Tathagata, he establishes them in the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment, etc.

original: de cho dag pa grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de cho dag pa grub par 'gyur //
translated: They become pure and accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nas dus de'i tshe ste bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa dang po'i tshe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nas dus de'i tshe ste bskal pa bzang po la sogs pa dang po'i tshe'o //
translated: Then, at that time, at the beginning of the Fortunate Aeon, etc.

original: sems can skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang bral bas dag pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa dang bral bas dag pa yin no //
translated: They are pure, because they are free from the addictions along with their instincts, in accordance with their good fortune.

original: khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang bskur ba thob pas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang bskur ba thob pas grub pa yin no //
translated: They are accomplished, because they have obtained the consecration of the sovereignty of the Dharma of the three worlds.

original: sangs rgyas kun sogs dngos grub pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun sogs dngos grub pa la /
translated: The accomplishment of all the Buddhas, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas na sangs rgyas kun te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas na sangs rgyas kun te /
translated: The Buddhas are all, therefore they are all the Buddhas.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o /🔽de rnams kyi dngos grub ni sangs rgyas kun sogs dngos grub ste //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o / de rnams kyi dngos grub ni sangs rgyas kun sogs dngos grub ste //
translated: They are Vairocana, etc.🔽Their accomplishment is the accomplishment of all the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub thob pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: de la sogs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje sems dpa'i bar gyi rigs thams cad kyi dngos grub gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kun sogs dngos grub ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa nas rdo rje sems dpa'i bar gyi rigs thams cad kyi dngos grub gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kun sogs dngos grub ste /
translated: The success of all the clans, beginning with Vajrasattva and ending with Vajrasattva, is the success of all the Buddhas, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kun sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi yul de la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun sogs pa'i dngos grub kyi yul de la'o //
translated: The object of the success of all the Buddhas, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, etc.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa des 'dus pa mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa yin te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa des 'dus pa mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsol ba btab pa yin te /
translated: The request of all the Buddhas who have gathered together is by that which is called Body, Speech, and Mind, etc.

original: 'dus pa mdzad nas rdo rje sems @269b dpa' la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ston par mdzad pa'i phyir gsol ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa mdzad nas rdo rje sems @269b dpa' la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ston par mdzad pa'i phyir gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: Having gathered together, they request Vajrasattva to teach the clan of the Tathagatas, because he is the one who has made the gathering.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs chen po //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs chen po //
translated: The great clan of the Tathagatas

original: sangs rgyas kun mchog bshad du gsol //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun mchog bshad du gsol //
translated: is the supreme of all the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs te /
translated: The mandala of the Tathagatas is the clan of the Tathagatas.

original: de yang nam mkha' thams cad khyab pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' thams cad khyab pas na chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it pervades all space.

original: sangs rgyas kun ni ji skad du bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ni ji skad du bshad pa rnams so //
translated: All buddhas are those who have been explained.

original: de rnams kyi mchog yin pas na sangs rgyas kun mchog ste /🔽byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyis sku'i gsang ba'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las dam par gyur pas na mchog ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog yin pas na sangs rgyas kun mchog ste / byang chub chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyis sku'i gsang ba'i tshul gyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las dam par gyur pas na mchog ste /
translated: Since it is the supreme of those, it is the supreme of all buddhas.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams sems de dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams sems de dang rjes su 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the supreme nature of the mind, which is characterized by great enlightenment, it is the supreme of the transcendent ones, by way of the secret of the body, because it is connected with that mind.

original: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: Then, all the buddhas

original: zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'dus nas byon pa de thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs la yang dag bzhugs
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs nyid la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'dus nas byon pa de thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs la yang dag bzhugs
translated: means that immediately after the supplication, all the buddhas equal with the particles of all world systems, such as Vairocana, having gathered and arrived, all of them abide in the body, speech, and mind of the great Vajradhara.

original: pas na / sku gsung thugs la yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: pas na / sku gsung thugs la yang dag bzhugs //
translated: Since they abide in the body, speech, and mind,🔽it is said that they abide in the body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes bya'o // sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //
translated: From the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: yang dag spros nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag spros nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: he emitted the perfect emanation and spoke this.🔽Thus it is.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la zhugs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis rdo rje sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la zhugs te /
translated: In this way, just explained, Vajrasattva entered into the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all the buddhas.

original: de nas 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Then he emitted the perfect emanation and spoke this.

original: ci zhig mdzad nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad nas she na /
translated: What did he do?

original: yang dag par spros nas zhes bya ba gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par spros nas zhes bya ba gsungs pa ste /
translated: He emitted the perfect emanation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la chu dang 'o ma ltar gcig tu gyur pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i mnyam pa'i spro ba de mdzad pa ni yang dag par mnyam par spro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje la chu dang 'o ma ltar gcig tu gyur pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i mnyam pa'i spro ba de mdzad pa ni yang dag par mnyam par spro ba'o //
translated: The emanation of the equality of Vajrasattva, who is one with the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas, like water poured into water, is the perfect emanation.🔽He spoke this.

original: 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba aom bhu kham zhes bya ba bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gsungs so zhes bya ba aom bhu kham zhes bya ba bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: He spoke this, “Oṃ bhuk.”

original: de nas 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Then, this, etc., is easy to understand.

original: bdud rnams bcom pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje gdan la bzhugs te /
analyzed: bdud rnams bcom pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje gdan la bzhugs te /
translated: The phrase having conquered the demons, etc. means that just as the Lord was seated on the vajra seat,

original: bdud bcom par mdzad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bdud bcom par mdzad pa de bzhin du /
translated: he conquered the demons.

original: de'i tshe 'dul bar mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad @270a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dul bar mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad @270a * //
translated: At that time, all the Buddhas who were to be tamed by him

original: kyis bdud bcom bar mdzad cing khams gsum pa der byang chub kyi snying por byin gyis brlabs shing brtan par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: kyis bdud bcom bar mdzad cing khams gsum pa der byang chub kyi snying por byin gyis brlabs shing brtan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: conquered the demons and blessed and stabilized the site of enlightenment in the three realms.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang bskur ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / log par spyod pa'i sems can 'dul ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa rnams 'dul ba la bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dbang bskur ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / log par spyod pa'i sems can 'dul ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa rnams 'dul ba la bya'o //
translated: The phrase etc. refers to the consecration, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, the taming of sentient beings with wrong conduct, and the taming of all the Buddhas gathered into one.

original: de la mi bskyod pa'i tshul gyis ni bdud rab tu bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mi bskyod pa'i tshul gyis ni bdud rab tu bcom pa yin no //
translated: In that regard, by the method of Akshobhya, the demons were completely conquered.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyis ni dbang bskur ba thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyis ni dbang bskur ba thob pa yin no //
translated: By Ratnasambhava, the consecration was obtained.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i tshul gyis ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i tshul gyis ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yin no //
translated: By Amitabha, the wheel of the Dharma was turned.

original: don yod par grub pa'i tshul gyis ni log par spyod pa'i sems can rnams 'dul ba yin no //
analyzed: don yod par grub pa'i tshul gyis ni log par spyod pa'i sems can rnams 'dul ba yin no //

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis ni sangs rgyas thams cad bsdus pa yin no //

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /

analyzed: de nas ston pa rdo rje 'dzin //

analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /

original: rtog pa kun gyi bde ba che //
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyi bde ba che //

analyzed: zhes bya ba rtog pa yang yin la kun kyang yin pas na rtog pa kun te /

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i tshul lo //

analyzed: de rnams kyi bde ba chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste /

analyzed: de thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dang / de'i rgyu mthun pa las byung bas /
translated: and because it is the cause of attaining that, and because it arises from the natural outcome of that,

original: dkyil 'khor 'di yang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'di yang /

original: rtog pa kun gyi bde ba che //
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyi bde ba che //

analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la'o //

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu phye sta bshad pas na yang dag rab bshad pa'o //

analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor te /

original: sku'i gsang ba gtsor gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul bas na dkyil 'khor gzhan las mchog tu gyur pas na dam pa yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba gtsor gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul bas na dkyil 'khor gzhan las mchog tu gyur pas na dam pa yin zhes bya'o //
translated: The reality of the great maṇḍala, which is the secret of the body, is the highest, because it is the taming of sentient beings to be tamed by the tathāgata family.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa nas nye bar bzung ste rnam par snang mdzad dkyil 'khor chen po 'di ji srid mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas de'i rjes thogs nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa mthong pa'i skal ba med pa'i sems can rnams skal ba dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor yang dag par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Then, immediately after that, in order to make fortunate those sentient beings who are not fortunate enough to see the Tathāgata, the maṇḍala should be drawn.

original: dbyibs ji lta bur bri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs ji lta bur bri bar bya zhe na /

analyzed: de'i mchog gang yin pa de ni dkyil 'khor chen po'i phyi'i mchog ces bya'o //

original: der ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: der ci zhig bya zhe na /

original: rdo rje 'khor lo yang dag bri //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo yang dag bri //🔽zhes bya ba ste /

original: rdo rje 'khor lo zlum po la rdo rje phreng ba'i tshul dang ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzad par byas pa'i dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje 'khor lo ste yang dag par bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: tshe mas mngon pa'i 'dzum pa gang yin ba de ni 'dzum pa snang ba yin la /

analyzed: 'di'i 'dzum pa mi mngon bas na mi snang ba ste /

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa mi bskyod pa'i sbyor bas bdud las rnam par rgyal bar byed cing /

analyzed: badzra satva / zhes zlos bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: To the right of the Blessed One Vairocana, in the place of Rati, the practitioner should draw Ākāśagarbha, etc., consecrated by the great jewel family, the nature of great wealth.

analyzed: du bri bar bya'o ;

analyzed: /'di skad ston te /

analyzed: rgyab tu byang chub sems dpa' dang ma nyam du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyab tu rdo rje dran ma'i gnas su rdo rje chos la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mnyam du lhan
translated: “On the back, the bodhisattvas and the Blessed One turning the wheel of Dharma” means that on the back of the Blessed Vairocana, in the place of Vajrasmrti, Vajradharma, etc., the bodhisattvas,

analyzed: cig chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing dam pa'i chos ston pa ste /

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /

translated: The yogin, meditating on the pride of being Amitābha, reciting vajra dharma, together with the bodhisattvas of the lotus family such as Vajradharma, should teach, All dharmas are pure by nature, and should paint the Bhagavat Buddha Amitābha.

original: g-yon du zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi g-yon logs rdo rje bsnyems ma'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: g-yon du zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi g-yon logs rdo rje bsnyems ma'i gnas su'o //
translated: On the left means in the place of Vajragarbha, to the left of the Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: log par rnam dregs pa ni dbang phyug @271b chen po la sogs pa dregs pa bdo ba rnams ni log par rnam par dregs pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log par rnam dregs pa ni dbang phyug @271b chen po la sogs pa dregs pa bdo ba rnams ni log par rnam par dregs pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The “wrongly proud” are those who are proud of their greatness, such as Maheśvara.

original: log par dregs pa de bsgrub pa ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i tshul sprul par mdzad nas de nas de rnams rang dbang du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: log par dregs pa de bsgrub pa ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs pa'i tshul sprul par mdzad nas de nas de rnams rang dbang du mdzad pa'o //
translated: Having accomplished that wrong pride, he then subjugated them by manifesting the form of Trailokyavijaya and so forth.

original: bstan pa dam pa la mngon par dga' zhing nan tan lhur byed pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: bstan pa dam pa la mngon par dga' zhing nan tan lhur byed pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention those who delight in the holy teaching and are intent on practice?🔽They are the holy ones who are greatly pleased.

analyzed: de dag ni shin tu yi rangs mdzad pa bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas don yod grub pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One Amoghasiddhi should be painted.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: sngags pas don yod par grub pa'i nga rgyal bskyed la /
analyzed: sngags pas don yod par grub pa'i nga rgyal bskyed la /
translated: The mantrin should generate the pride of being Amoghasiddhi.

analyzed: badzra karma zhes zlos shing rang gi lus las rdo rje rigs rnams spros la /
translated: Reciting “vajra karma,” he emanates the vajra family from his body.

analyzed: des lha chen po la sogs dregs pa bdo ba'i sems can btul te /
translated: Having subdued the haughty beings such as Maheśvara,🔽he should imagine that they are brought under control.

analyzed: badzra karma / zhes bya ba'i snying po 'dis bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go bar zad do //

analyzed: mtshams kyi char ni rdo rje dang // rin chen sdong bu nor bu bri'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nang gi dkyil 'khor de nyid kyi me'i mtshams su rdo rje rtse lnga pa /

original: bden bral du rdo rje rin chen /🔽rlung gi mtshams su sdong bu ste rdo rje padma /
analyzed: bden bral du rdo rje rin chen / rlung gi mtshams su sdong bu ste rdo rje padma /
translated: In the southwest, he should draw a vajra jewel.🔽In the northwest, he should draw a tree vajra.

analyzed: dbang ldan du sna tshogs rdo rje'i ming nor bu zhes bya ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the northeast, he should draw a jewel called a crossed vajra.

original: de nas 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //🔽mtshams rnams su ni lha mor bshad ;
analyzed: de nas 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni go sla'o // mtshams rnams su ni lha mor bshad ;
translated: Then, “these” is easy to understand.

original: / ces bya ba ni /🔽sgeg mo bzhad ma glu chen mo //
analyzed: / ces bya ba ni / sgeg mo bzhad ma glu chen mo //
translated: The goddesses are explained in the intermediate directions.

analyzed: gar mdzad ma ste lha mo'i tshogs //

analyzed: 'di dag rdo rje rnam sgeg mo'i // phyi yi mtshams su bya bar bshad //

original: ces rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa de nyid 'dir bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa de nyid 'dir bri bar bya'o //
translated: The goddesses of the outer intermediate directions are to be drawn as they are taught in the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva.

original: sgo nyid du ni lcags kyu zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po rdo rje lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / rdo rje dril bu zhes gsungs pa de 'dir sgo ru bri bar bya'o //🔽de bzhin snga ma ji lta bzhin //
analyzed: sgo nyid du ni lcags kyu zhes bya ba ni bde ba chen po rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po rdo rje lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / lcags sgrog dang / rdo rje dril bu zhes gsungs pa de 'dir sgo ru bri bar bya'o // de bzhin snga ma ji lta bzhin //
translated: At the gates, the hook and so forth. The hook, noose, shackle, and vajra bell are taught in the great maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, the great bliss. They are to be drawn at the gates here.

original: 'khor lo de ni brtag par bya //
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni brtag par bya //
translated: As before, the wheel is to be imagined.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das rnam @272a * //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das rnam @272a * //
translated: The Blessed One, the great hero, is to be imagined in the center of the wheel.

original: par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor de legs par bris la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bris pa'i tshul gyis cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad do //
analyzed: par snang mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor de legs par bris la rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bris pa'i tshul gyis cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad do //
translated: Having drawn that mandala of Vairocana well, one should perform all the rites in the manner of drawing the mandala of Vajrasattva.

original: de nas mchod pa'i thal mo zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i thal mo zhes bya ba /
translated: Then, the “worship añjali” is as follows:

original: thal mo khong stong snying gar bcings //
analyzed: thal mo khong stong snying gar bcings //
translated: The añjali with the hollowed hands at the heart,

original: zhes bya ba rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su bcings la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rang gi snying ga'i phyogs su bcings la /
translated: having bound it at the region of one’s heart,

original: g-yon du de bzhin bskor ba ni //
analyzed: g-yon du de bzhin bskor ba ni //
translated: turning it to the left in the same way,

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying ga'i g-yon logs su de bzhin gshegs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis bskor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi snying ga'i g-yon logs su de bzhin gshegs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis bskor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that one should turn it to the left of one’s heart in the same way as the Tathāgatas explained above.

original: me tog dang bcas phyag rgya 'di //
analyzed: me tog dang bcas phyag rgya 'di //
translated: This mudrā with the flower🔽is the one pledge of all the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig gcig / ces bya ba ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi dam tshig gcig / ces bya ba ni go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is self-evident.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dam tshig gi rim pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dam tshig gi rim pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba'o //
translated: Then, the “pledge-seal” is as follows:

original: bsam pa g-yos pas 'dud par bya //
analyzed: bsam pa g-yos pas 'dud par bya //
translated: One should bow with a wavering thought.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos pa phul du byung bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag par mos pa phul du byung bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should bow to all the Tathagatas with the most excellent faith.

original: de nas phyag byas la me tog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag byas la me tog dor bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having bowed, one should cast the flower.

original: gang gi dus su zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dus su zhe na /
translated: At what time?

original: bskor ba lan gsum byas nas ni //
analyzed: bskor ba lan gsum byas nas ni //
translated: Having circumambulated three times,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: one should cast the flower.

original: bskor ba lan gsum byas nas so //
analyzed: bskor ba lan gsum byas nas so //
translated: Having circumambulated three times,

original: shin tu gsang bas yang dag dgug / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu gsang bas yang dag dgug / ces bya ba ni /
translated: one should summon with the secret mantra.

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a na'm a'a dya nutpa nan tv'a ta /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a na'm a'a dya nutpa nan tv'a ta /
translated: Om akaro mukha sarva dharmanam adyanutpannatvat.

original: ces zlos shing gsang ba'i lhags kyu mas dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces zlos shing gsang ba'i lhags kyu mas dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: Reciting this, one should summon, induct, bind, and control with the secret mantra.

original: de nas cho ga ji bzhin du //
analyzed: de nas cho ga ji bzhin du //
translated: Then, according to the rite,

original: ston pa la ni me tog dor //
analyzed: ston pa la ni me tog dor //
translated: one should cast the flower to the teacher.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa gsang ba'i lcags kyus dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor dang bcas pa gsang ba'i lcags kyus dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba la ji lta ba bzhin du zhugs te /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One Vairocana together with the retinue, having been summoned by the secret hook, having entered into the rite of summoning, inducting, binding, and controlling,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po bshad pa'i tshogs cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la me tog dor ba'i sngags kyis me tog gi sil ma dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen po bshad pa'i tshogs cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la me tog dor ba'i sngags kyis me tog gi sil ma dor bar bya'o //
translated: having performed all the rites of the assembly of the explanation of the great maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, one should scatter flower petals with the mantra for scattering flowers.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub rab grub phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub rab grub phyir //
translated: In order to accomplish the enlightenment of buddhahood,

original: 'gro ba'i mgon la de nyid brjod //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mgon la de nyid brjod //
translated: one should recite that reality to the lord of migrating beings.

original: ces bya ba ni bskor ba lan gsum byas nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mdun du 'dug ste /🔽'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bskor ba lan gsum byas nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mdun du 'dug ste / 'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
translated: Having circumambulated three times, one should sit in front of the Blessed One Vairocana

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i de kho na nyid 'gro ba'i mgon po bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi spyan sngar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i de kho na nyid 'gro ba'i mgon po bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi spyan sngar brjod par bya'o //
translated: and recite the reality that was previously explained, “Great desire, great bliss,” and so on, in front of the Blessed One Vairocana, the lord of migrating beings.

original: @272b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @272b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sangs rgyas byang chub rab grub phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub rab grub phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In order to fully accomplish the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bo //
translated: The enlightenment of the Buddhas is the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du phul du byung ba bsgrub pa ni rab grub pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phul du byung ba bsgrub pa ni rab grub pa ste /
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of the supreme is the full accomplishment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste shin tu grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste shin tu grub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to fully accomplish the enlightenment of the Buddhas.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.🔽The essence mantra is:

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a na'm a'a dya nutba nan tv'a ta /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham sarba dharm'a na'm a'a dya nutba nan tv'a ta /
translated: Oṃ akaro mukhaṃ sarvadharmāṇām ādya-anutpā-da-tva.

original: ces bya ba'i snying po dang drul bu dang bcas pa'i gsang ba'i lcags kyu ma dang 'bebs pas dgug cing spyan drangs nas myur ba nyid du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus shing byon par 'gyur ro //🔽thams cad ma skyes sbyor ba yis ;
analyzed: ces bya ba'i snying po dang drul bu dang bcas pa'i gsang ba'i lcags kyu ma dang 'bebs pas dgug cing spyan drangs nas myur ba nyid du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus shing byon par 'gyur ro // thams cad ma skyes sbyor ba yis ;
translated: Having invoked and summoned with the secret hook and the descent, all the Buddhas, such as Vairocana, will quickly assemble and arrive.🔽By the yoga of the non-arising of all,

original: / zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis ma skyes pa ni /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis ma skyes pa ni /
translated: the non-arising of all is the non-arising of all phenomena.

original: thams cad ma skyes pa ste chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad ma skyes pa ste chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: All are unborn, the suchness of all phenomena is unborn.

original: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba des dngos grub kun ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po'i dngos grub thams cad stsol zhing ster bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba des dngos grub kun ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sgrub pa po'i dngos grub thams cad stsol zhing ster bar mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that yoga of the mind, which is of one taste as suchness, all powers are granted, all powers of the practitioner, such as Vairochana, are granted and bestowed.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “for” means “because.”

original: gang gi phyir 'dus pa rnams thams cad ma skyes pa'i sbyor bas sgrub pa po'i dngos grub thams cad rnal 'byor pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyis stsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus pa rnams thams cad ma skyes pa'i sbyor bas sgrub pa po'i dngos grub thams cad rnal 'byor pa la sangs rgyas thams cad kyis stsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all assemblies are granted all powers of the practitioner by all buddhas through the yoga of the unborn.

original: zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor der zhugs nas so //
analyzed: zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor der zhugs nas so //
translated: Having entered,

original: dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: all powers will be accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor der zhugs nas phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor der zhugs nas phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having entered that maṇḍala, all powers such as the great seal will be accomplished.

original: dga' ba la sogs mtshan ma mchog / sna tshogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' ba la sogs mtshan ma mchog / sna tshogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: The signs of joy and so forth, the supreme, will arise in variety.

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor der zhugs nas sgrub par byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa la dngos grub kyi ltas dga' ba dang / yid bde ba dang / 'od zer mthong ba la sogs pa'i mchan ma'i mchog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor der zhugs nas sgrub par byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa la dngos grub kyi ltas dga' ba dang / yid bde ba dang / 'od zer mthong ba la sogs pa'i mchan ma'i mchog ste /
translated: Having entered that mandala, the practitioner will generate and produce the supreme signs of the signs of siddhi, such as joy, mental satisfaction, and seeing light rays, and so forth.

original: dam pa'i tshul rnam pa sna tshogs skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i tshul rnam pa sna tshogs skye zhing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The supreme way is the variety of types.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, after the master’s ritual actions,

original: mchog tu slob ma gzhug pa ni dkyil 'khor chen por ro //
analyzed: mchog tu slob ma gzhug pa ni dkyil 'khor chen por ro //
translated: the supreme initiation of the disciple is in the great mandala.

original: cho ga rgyas pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: cho ga rgyas pa de bzhin no //
translated: The extensive rite is just like that.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir slob dpon gyis rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa'i slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa thams cad 'dir bya ba yin @273a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir slob dpon gyis rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor chen por bshad pa'i slob ma 'jug pa'i cho ga rgyas pa thams cad 'dir bya ba yin @273a * //
translated: Here, the master should perform all the extensive rites of the disciple’s entrance as explained in the great mandala of Vajrasattva.

original: no ; / mchod pa'i thal mos 'khor lo che //
analyzed: no ; / mchod pa'i thal mos 'khor lo che //
translated: With the gesture of homage, the great wheel

original: mchod pa byas nas slar 'byung bya //
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas slar 'byung bya //
translated: Having made offerings, one should exit.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por mchod pa'i thal mo des me tog dang / bdug spos dang / mar me dang / dri la sogs pa blangs nas me tog la sogs pa der 'khor lo che zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor mchod pa byas nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la dkyil 'khor chen po de las slar 'byung bar bya'o //🔽dngos grub cho ga ji bzhin du //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang 'di na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor chen por mchod pa'i thal mo des me tog dang / bdug spos dang / mar me dang / dri la sogs pa blangs nas me tog la sogs pa der 'khor lo che zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor mchod pa byas nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la dkyil 'khor chen po de las slar 'byung bar bya'o // dngos grub cho ga ji bzhin du //
translated: This is the procedure for the great maṇḍala of the Tathāgata. Having taken flowers, incense, lamps, perfume, etc. with that same offering añjali, one should make offerings to the great maṇḍala called the “Wheel” with those flowers, etc. and perform all the rites, and then exit from that great maṇḍala.🔽The accomplishments, as prescribed by the rite,

original: sgrub pa rnams ni rab bshad bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa rnams ni rab bshad bya //
translated: will be explained in full.

original: zhes bya ba la dngos grub ni bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dngos grub ni bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Accomplishment” is the result of practice.

original: cho ga ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni cho ga'i rim pa ma 'chol bar ro //
analyzed: cho ga ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni cho ga'i rim pa ma 'chol bar ro //
translated: “As prescribed by the rite” means without confusing the sequence of the rite.

original: sgrub ces bya ba ni 'dis sgrub pas na bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub ces bya ba ni 'dis sgrub pas na bsgrub pa ste /
translated: “Practice” is that which is practiced.

original: ras ris la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ras ris la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the painting, etc.

original: rab bshad bya zhes bya ba ni de rab tu phye ste sgrub pa dang dngos grub bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ste ci yang rung ba'i tshul du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab bshad bya zhes bya ba ni de rab tu phye ste sgrub pa dang dngos grub bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ste ci yang rung ba'i tshul du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not mean that I will explain just anything.

original: de la cho ga ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la cho ga ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni sgra'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, the phrase in accordance with the ritual has the following meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs la rang gi lha'i sngags dang / phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du blangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs la rang gi lha'i sngags dang / phyag rgya ji lta ba bzhin du blangs te /
translated: One should enter the maṇḍala of the Tathāgatas, and take up the mantra and the mudrā of one's deity in accordance with the ritual.

original: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la mdun du rang gi lha spyan drangs pa dang ; mchod pa dang / phyag byas nas de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la mdun du rang gi lha spyan drangs pa dang ; mchod pa dang / phyag byas nas de'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Having performed the yoga of one's deity, one should invite one's deity in front, make offerings and salutations, and form the pledge mudrā of that deity.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas ras ris la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du nye reg lan cig byas la /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas ras ris la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du nye reg lan cig byas la /
translated: Having performed the consecration of oneself and so forth, one should perform the sprinkling ritual once in accordance with the painting and so forth.

original: zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bzlas brjod byas la de nas ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshul lam dpa' bo gcig pu 'dir gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bzlas brjod byas la de nas ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshul lam dpa' bo gcig pu 'dir gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should recite for one month, and then, in the manner explained, one should install the painting in the maṇḍala or in the form of this solitary hero.

original: de'i mdun du bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: de'i mdun du bdag la byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: In front of it, having performed the self-consecration,

original: ras ris la rang gi lha ji lta ba bzhin du spyan drangs nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad pa'am /
analyzed: ras ris la rang gi lha ji lta ba bzhin du spyan drangs nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad pa'am /
translated: one should invite one’s deity in the painting, just as it is, and perform all the rites.

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yang zla ba gcig gi bar du bzlas brjod byas la /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis yang zla ba gcig gi bar du bzlas brjod byas la /
translated: Or, with the great seal of one’s deity, as previously explained, one should recite for one month.

original: mthar zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: mthar zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: At the end, on the full moon night, one should recite throughout the night.

original: de nas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub rnams grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub rnams grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, one will attain the powers as desired.

original: don 'di nyid ston pas ni /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ston pas ni /
translated: This very meaning is taught by the Bhagavān:

original: bdud la sogs @273b las rnam rgyal brnyes //
analyzed: bdud la sogs @273b las rnam rgyal brnyes //
translated: “One attains victory over Māra and so forth,

original: bcom ldan ras la bri bar bya //
analyzed: bcom ldan ras la bri bar bya //
translated: and should paint the Bhagavān on cloth.

original: sgrub pa 'di las gcig tsam ni //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di las gcig tsam ni //
translated: In this practice, even just one

original: de lta'i bsgrub byas sgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta'i bsgrub byas sgrub par 'gyur //
translated: One will accomplish the object of practice in that way.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni dkyil 'khor gyi ras ris sgrub pa la gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni dkyil 'khor gyi ras ris sgrub pa la gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is said to be the practice of the mandala painting.

original: dpa' bo gcig pu'i dbang du byas nas /🔽sku gzugs la sogs mdun du yang ;
analyzed: dpa' bo gcig pu'i dbang du byas nas / sku gzugs la sogs mdun du yang ;
translated: With regard to the single hero,

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: it is said, “In front of the image, etc.”

original: 'di ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: 'di ni go bar zad do //
translated: This is self-evident.

original: 'dis kyang 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This also teaches the following.

original: snga ma bzhin du rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la zla ba gcig tsam bzlas par brjod byas nas rang gi lha dpa' bo gcig pu ras la sogs pa la gzhug pa mdun du gzhug ste cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la zla ba gcig tsam bzlas par brjod byas nas rang gi lha dpa' bo gcig pu ras la sogs pa la gzhug pa mdun du gzhug ste cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
translated: As before, one should form the pledge seal of one’s deity, and having recited the mantra for a month, one should place the single hero of one’s deity on cloth, etc., and place it in front. One should perform all the rites in their entirety.

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la slar bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la slar bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: Forming the great seal of one’s deity, one should recite the mantra a hundred thousand times.

original: de nas zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na de lta bus ni rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na de lta bus ni rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, on the night of the full moon, one should recite the mantra all night long. By that, one will attain the power of the great seal of one's deity.

original: rgyud 'di la thams cad du yang ras ris sgrub pa la /
analyzed: rgyud 'di la thams cad du yang ras ris sgrub pa la /
translated: In this tantra, in all cases, for the accomplishment of the painting,

original: lce la rdo rje dkar po bsams te bzlas brjod bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lce la rdo rje dkar po bsams te bzlas brjod bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: one should visualize a white vajra on the tongue and recite the mantra.

original: gzhung 'dis ni chos kyi phyag rgya sgrub pa yang bshad par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhung 'dis ni chos kyi phyag rgya sgrub pa yang bshad par gyur pa yin te /
translated: By this passage, the accomplishment of the doctrine seal is also explained.

original: gang gi phyir phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya rnams bsgrubs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la ston pa yin gyi chos kyi phyag rgya ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyag rgya chen po dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / las kyi phyag rgya rnams bsgrubs pa'i rjes thogs nyid la ston pa yin gyi chos kyi phyag rgya ni ma yin no //
translated: This is because the great seal, the pledge seal, and the action seal are taught immediately after the accomplishment, but not the doctrine seal.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya'i sgrub pa chen po'i rgyud ni zhes bya ba ni de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya'i sgrub pa chen po'i rgyud ni zhes bya ba ni de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Then, the great tantra of the accomplishment of the tathāgata seal, the phrase then means at that time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The great seal of the Tathāgata’s family in the maṇḍala of the Tathāgata is the seal of the Tathāgata.

original: de rnams kyi sgrub pa chen po ni rang gi sku'i ngo bor bdag nyid bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrub pa chen po ni rang gi sku'i ngo bor bdag nyid bsgom pa'o //
translated: The great practice of those is the meditation on oneself as having the nature of one’s own body.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra ni tshogs rgyud do //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra ni tshogs rgyud do //
translated: The sound that teaches that is the tantra of the assembly.

original: phyag rgya gcig bcings nas ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya gcig bcings nas ni //
translated: Having bound the single seal,

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin bsams na //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin bsams na //
translated: one should think “I am the Buddha.”

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
translated: This means that one should bind the great seal of Vairocana, etc.,

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin no zhes bsgom zhing yang dang yang du mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas yin no zhes bsgom zhing yang dang yang du mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: and meditate on oneself as the Buddha, repeatedly actualizing it.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: phyag rgya chen po dngos grub che //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po dngos grub che //
translated: The great seal’s great power

original: brtan pa ring por mi thogs thob //
analyzed: brtan pa ring por mi thogs thob //
translated: is attained by the steadfast one before long.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam par snang mdzad @274a * //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad @274a * //
translated: Vairocana, etc.,

original: la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni bdag nyid yin no zhes bsgoms na /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po bcings nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni bdag nyid yin no zhes bsgoms na /
translated: and so forth, and having bound the great seal, one should meditate on the nature of Vairochana, etc., as being oneself.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bcar du ming cing gzhig tu med par brtan pa ring por mi thogs shing myur ba nyid du thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub bcar du ming cing gzhig tu med par brtan pa ring por mi thogs shing myur ba nyid du thob pa'o //
translated: The yogi/nī will quickly, not long at all, attain the firm, unbreakable, face-to-face, great seal siddhi of Vairochana, etc.

original: de ltar phyag rgya chen po'i bsgrub pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya chen po'i bsgrub pa gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the great seal practice,

original: da ni dam tshig thams cad sgrub pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig thams cad sgrub pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: now, in order to teach the practice of all pledges,

original: de nas dam tshig thams cad sgrub pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nas dam tshig thams cad sgrub pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then, the practice of all pledges.🔽”

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word “then” is as before.

original: dam tshig thams cad ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya thams cad do //
analyzed: dam tshig thams cad ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya thams cad do //
translated: All pledges are all pledge seals.

original: de rnams kyis sgrub pa ni rang gi snying gar sems dpa'i rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: de rnams kyis sgrub pa ni rang gi snying gar sems dpa'i rdo rje bsams la /
translated: The practice of those is as follows: Having visualized the vajra being at one’s heart,

original: sa ma ya stvam /
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam /
translated: one should recite “samaya stvaṃ.

original: zhes phyag rgya bcing ba'i snying po zlos shing bcing ba'o //
analyzed: zhes phyag rgya bcing ba'i snying po zlos shing bcing ba'o //
