translated: Reciting “samaya stvam hi,” one should generate the maṇḍala of light, and by entering it, the Bhagavān and oneself become one.

original: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba bsgoms la /
analyzed: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba bsgoms la /
translated: Meditate on the vajra blazing like fire.

original: dza: h'um bam ho:/
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho:/
translated: Recite “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ”

original: sa ma ya stvam ham ho zhes lan gsum bzla par bya'o //
analyzed: sa ma ya stvam ham ho zhes lan gsum bzla par bya'o //
translated: and “samaya stvam hi hoḥ” three times.

original: de nas chos dang las dang / phyag rgya chen pos bcom ldan 'das rgyas btab la /
analyzed: de nas chos dang las dang / phyag rgya chen pos bcom ldan 'das rgyas btab la /
translated: Then, seal the Bhagavān with the Dharma, action, and great seal.🔽Reciting “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” mentally say “excellent” and imagine all buddhas enter one’s body.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: / zhes zlos shing yid kyis legs so zhes bya ba'i sbyor bas rang gi lus la sangs rgyas thams cad bcug la rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis de bsgrub
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: / zhes zlos shing yid kyis legs so zhes bya ba'i sbyor bas rang gi lus la sangs rgyas thams cad bcug la rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis de bsgrub
translated: One should accomplish that with the tathāgata pledge seals explained in the Great Maṇḍala of the Vajra Realm.

original: par bya'o // de nas de las bshad pa'i chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis de rnams la rgyas btab la /
analyzed: par bya'o // de nas de las bshad pa'i chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams kyis de rnams la rgyas btab la /
translated: Then, seal them with the Dharma, action, and great seals explained in that [Vajra Element] tantra.

original: dang po'i rdo rje bcings te /
analyzed: dang po'i rdo rje bcings te /
translated: First, having bound the adamantine fist,

original: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pas bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pas bdag nyid byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: one should bless oneself with Vajrasattva, etc., as before.

original: de nas yi ge brgya pas brtan par byas la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i mchog gi phyag rgyas sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan gyi dbang dang / rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba'i phreng bas dbang bskur ba blangs la yi ge gnyis kyi go chas bdag nyid go bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yi ge brgya pas brtan par byas la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i mchog gi phyag rgyas sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan gyi dbang dang / rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'bar ba'i phreng bas dbang bskur ba blangs la yi ge gnyis kyi go chas bdag nyid go bgo bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having stabilized with the hundred-syllable [mantra], one should take the empowerment of the crown of the five buddhas with the seal of the supreme body of all the Ones-Gone-Thus, and the empowerment of the five-crested blazing vajra with the seal of the empowerment conferral of the Vajra-Garland Tantra, and one should don the armor of oneself with the two-syllable armor.

original: de nas khro bo rdo rje rtse lnga pas bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba blangs la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khro bo rdo rje rtse lnga pas bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba blangs la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs blang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken the empowerment of the lord and the name empowerment with the wrathful five-crested vajra, one should take the spiritual powers and the vajra-conduct.

original: de nas khro bo'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa gnyis kyis rdo rje bzung zhing chos kyi dril bu dkrol la dam tshig gi phyag rgya chen por byin gyis brlabs nas h'um lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khro bo'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa gnyis kyis rdo rje bzung zhing chos kyi dril bu dkrol la dam tshig gi phyag rgya chen por byin gyis brlabs nas h'um lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, holding the vajra with the two secret offerings, the wrathful vajra weapon and so forth, ringing the dharma bell, and empowered with the great pledge seal, one should recite HŪṃ three times.

original: de nas rdo rje gsor zhing khro gnyer dang 'dzum pa dang bcas pas sdud par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gsor zhing khro gnyer dang 'dzum pa dang bcas pas sdud par bya'o //
translated: Then, brandishing the vajra with a frown and a smile, one should gather.

original: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
translated: Then, having bound the great seal,🔽one should recite:

original: kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste //
analyzed: kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste //
translated: I am the supreme of all, the great attainment,🔽the great lord, the supreme master,

original: dbang phyug che nyid bdag po mchog / rdo rje sems dpar bdag gyur cig /
analyzed: dbang phyug che nyid bdag po mchog / rdo rje sems dpar bdag gyur cig /
translated: and I am Vajrasattva.

original: de skad ces brjod la rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces brjod la rab tu bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having recited this, one should accomplish it.

original: lce la rdo rje dkar po de la h'um bsam mo //
analyzed: lce la rdo rje dkar po de la h'um bsam mo //
translated: On the tongue one should visualize a white vajra with HŪṃ.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i gnas su h'um mdzad sgrub par byed pa'i yi ge h'um bris la bdag nyid rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang / gzugs brnyan tsam dang @297a * //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i gnas su h'um mdzad sgrub par byed pa'i yi ge h'um bris la bdag nyid rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang / gzugs brnyan tsam dang @297a * //
translated: One should visualize oneself as Vajra-jvalanāgni, and the image as merely a reflection.

original: mtshungs par bsam zhing bzlas pa'i don la dmigs shing zla ba gcig gi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par bsam zhing bzlas pa'i don la dmigs shing zla ba gcig gi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on this for one month, visualizing the meaning of the mantra.

original: mdun du yang ras ris la sogs pa la bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba bzhin du spyan drangs la /
analyzed: mdun du yang ras ris la sogs pa la bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba bzhin du spyan drangs la /
translated: In front of oneself, one should invite the Blessed One, just as before, into the painting and so forth.

original: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la phyag byas nas rdo rje gsor ba'i phyag rgyas yi ge h'um bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod la phyag byas nas rdo rje gsor ba'i phyag rgyas yi ge h'um bzlas brjod 'bum bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to him with all offerings, and having prostrated, one should recite the syllable hūṃ one hundred thousand times with the vajra-brandishing gesture.

original: de nas zla ba nya ba'i dus su mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: de nas zla ba nya ba'i dus su mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: Then, at the time of the full moon, one should recite the mantra throughout the night.

original: nang par rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang par rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the morning, one will become equal to Vajra-jvalanāgni.

original: yang na hi zhes bya ba de bzhin du bsgrubs la zla ba gcig tsam bzlas la de'i rjes la ras ris kyi mdun du stong phrag brgya bzlas nas mthar yang zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: yang na hi zhes bya ba de bzhin du bsgrubs la zla ba gcig tsam bzlas la de'i rjes la ras ris kyi mdun du stong phrag brgya bzlas nas mthar yang zla ba nya ba la mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: Then, in front of the painting, having recited one hundred thousand times, one should recite all night on the night of the full moon.

original: nyi ma 'chang ba'i dus su rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma 'chang ba'i dus su rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of sunrise, one will become like Vajra Jvālamālī.

original: de nas phyag rgya chen po bsgrub par 'dod na de bzhin du thams cad byas la /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya chen po bsgrub par 'dod na de bzhin du thams cad byas la /
translated: “Then, if one wishes to accomplish the great seal, one should do everything in the same way.

original: zla ba gcig tsam du bzlas brjod dpag tu med pa bzlas nas thams cad bya'o zhes bsgom mo //
analyzed: zla ba gcig tsam du bzlas brjod dpag tu med pa bzlas nas thams cad bya'o zhes bsgom mo //
translated: Having recited the immeasurable recitation for one month, one should meditate on everything.🔽Then, having placed it in front of the Blessed One as before, one should meditate for one month.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar gzhag / yang zla ba gcig tsam bsgoms la mthar de bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms na rdo rje 'chang ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar gzhag / yang zla ba gcig tsam bsgoms la mthar de bzhin du mtshan thog thag bsgoms na rdo rje 'chang ba dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end, having meditated all night in the same way, one will become like Vajradhara.”

original: 'on te dam tshig gi phyag rgya bsgrub par 'dod na de bzhin du thams cad byas nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la h'um yid kyis bri'o //
analyzed: 'on te dam tshig gi phyag rgya bsgrub par 'dod na de bzhin du thams cad byas nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje la h'um yid kyis bri'o //
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the pledge seal, one should do everything as before, and mentally write hum on the vajra at one's heart.

original: de nas chos thams cad gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid bar bsgoms la dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas zla ba gcig tsam du h'um bzlas la /
analyzed: de nas chos thams cad gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid bar bsgoms la dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas zla ba gcig tsam du h'um bzlas la /
translated: Then, having meditated on all phenomena as having the nature of non-entity like a reflection, one should form the pledge seal and recite hum for one month.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du mdun du bzhag la zla ba gzhan la bdag gis thams cad gsang par bya'o zhes brjod la dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du mdun du bzhag la zla ba gzhan la bdag gis thams cad gsang par bya'o zhes brjod la dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Then, having set up the Bhagavat as before, one should say, For another month I will keep everything secret, and forming the pledge seal, one should recite the mantra.

original: mthar de bzhin du mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar de bzhin du mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the end, having recited the mantra throughout the night as before, one will attain the state of Vajradhara.

original: 'on te las kyi phyag rgya bsgrub par 'dod na de bzhin du chog thams cad rjes su spyad la 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa'i khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mchod @297b pa rnam pa bcu drug gis mchod
analyzed: 'on te las kyi phyag rgya bsgrub par 'dod na de bzhin du chog thams cad rjes su spyad la 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa las gsungs pa'i khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i las kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mchod @297b pa rnam pa bcu drug gis mchod
translated: If one wishes to accomplish the karma consort, one should perform all the rites as before, and one should worship with the sixteen forms of worship taught in the chapter on the karma mandala of Trailokyavijaya in the Arya-tattvasamgraha.

original: pa dang / phyag byas la bcom ldan 'das kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la h'um bsams nas de nyid bzlas shing zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang / phyag byas la bcom ldan 'das kyi las kyi phyag rgya bcings nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje la h'um bsams nas de nyid bzlas shing zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should make obeisance, bind the karma mudra of the Bhagavat, imagine a hum at the center of the vajra cross at one's heart, and meditate on that while reciting it for one month.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das mdun du bzhag la mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das mdun du bzhag la mchod pa thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Again, one should place the Bhagavat in front of oneself and worship him with all the offerings.

original: yang zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bzlas brjod byas te /
analyzed: yang zla ba gcig tsam gyi bar du bzlas brjod byas te /
translated: Again, one should recite the mantra for one month.

original: mtshan thog thag bzlas shing bsgoms nas de'i rjes la nyi ma 'char kar rdo rje h'um mdzad dang 'dra ba yas thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan thog thag bzlas shing bsgoms nas de'i rjes la nyi ma 'char kar rdo rje h'um mdzad dang 'dra ba yas thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having recited and meditated throughout the night, then at sunrise, one will become like Vajra Hūṃkara.

original: de ltar na de nas rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te bsgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rgyud do zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ni slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de nas rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te bsgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rgyud do zhes bya ba'i bar gyi bshad pas ni slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma 'jug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the extensive tantra of the ritual of practice, beginning with “Then, Vajradhara,” up to “the extensive ritual,” explains the ritual of the master’s actions and the extensive ritual of inducting the disciples, and so on.

original: yang 'di'i don brjod par byas te /
analyzed: yang 'di'i don brjod par byas te /
translated: Now, having stated the meaning of this,

original: bdag dang gnas bsrung ba byas la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor mdun du bskyed nas mngon sum dang 'dra bar bltas la /
analyzed: bdag dang gnas bsrung ba byas la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor mdun du bskyed nas mngon sum dang 'dra bar bltas la /
translated: one should protect oneself and the place, and having generated the maṇḍala of Vajra-Acala in front with the mudra of the vajra wheel, one should view it as if it were directly present.

original: gal te 'byor ba yod na me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas dkyil 'khor lnga pas phyag bya pa dang / phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas snga ma bzhin du sdom pa gzung bar bya'o //🔽de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal ma la sogs pa nas dam tshig gi khu tshur bcing ba'i bar gyis phyag rgya bcing ba thams cad byas la de nas yi ge h'um zlos shing rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa nas lha mo rdo rje
analyzed: gal te 'byor ba yod na me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas dkyil 'khor lnga pas phyag bya pa dang / phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas snga ma bzhin du sdom pa gzung bar bya'o // de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal ma la sogs pa nas dam tshig gi khu tshur bcing ba'i bar gyis phyag rgya bcing ba thams cad byas la de nas yi ge h'um zlos shing rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa nas lha mo rdo rje
translated: If one has the means, having made offerings with flowers, etc., one should make obeisance with the Five-Prostration Circumambulation, and having gone before the Four-Limbed Homage, etc., one should take up the vow as before.

original: dril bu ma'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bcings la de'i snying po lan gsum bzlas nas /
analyzed: dril bu ma'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bcings la de'i snying po lan gsum bzlas nas /
translated: Then, having made all the seal-impression with the Vajra-Palm, etc., up to the binding of the pledge-fists, one should recite the syllable hūṃ and bind the pledge-seals of Vajra-Blazing-Fire, etc., up to Vajra-Goddess-Bell, and repeat their essence three times.

original: aom badzra mu:/ zhes bya bas dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams rang gi snying gar gzhug go //
analyzed: aom badzra mu:/ zhes bya bas dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams rang gi snying gar gzhug go //
translated: Then, with oṃ vajra muḥ, one should cause the pledge-seals to enter one’s heart.

original: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kyang rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar bar yid kyis gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kyang rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar bar yid kyis gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Also, the forms of Vajra Flame and so forth should be mentally introduced into the blazing vajra in one’s heart.

original: de nas sdig pa dral ba'i phyag rgyas sdig pa thams cad dral bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sdig pa dral ba'i phyag rgyas sdig pa thams cad dral bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with the mudrā of extracting evil, one should extract all evil.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba la h'um yid kyis bris la de nyid yid la zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba la h'um yid kyis bris la de nyid yid la zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having mentally written the syllable hūṃ in the blazing vajra in one’s heart, repeating that very [syllable] in one’s mind, one should meditate on the selflessness of all phenomena.

original: de nas @298a * //
analyzed: de nas @298a * //
translated: Then,

original: de bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la bcom ldan 'das rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i phyag rgya chen po bcing bar bya'o //
translated: having performed all the rites in the same way, one should bind the great mudrā of the Blessed One Vajra Flame.

original: de nas nam mkha' rab 'byam gyi tshad tsam gyi rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sbyor bas zhugs la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' rab 'byam gyi tshad tsam gyi rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i sbyor bas zhugs la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar rab tu 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the yoga equal to space, enter into the moon mandala in one’s heart, the size of the realm of space, and generate the mandala of Vajra-Blaze-of-Fire with the vajra wheel gesture.

original: de nas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i bdag nyid bsams la 'jug pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la de nyid kyis me tog gi phreng ba blangs la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i bdag nyid bsams la 'jug pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings la de nyid kyis me tog gi phreng ba blangs la /
translated: Then, having imagined oneself as Vajra-Blaze-of-Fire, form the pledge gesture of entry, and with that very gesture take up the flower garland.

original: dkyil 'khor der yid kyis 'jug pa'i glu len cing 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der yid kyis 'jug pa'i glu len cing 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Then, singing the song of entering into that mandala, one should enter.

original: de nas me tog dor ba'i glu len cing rang gi mgor me tog gi phreng ba dor la de nas ji lta ba bzhin bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas me tog dor ba'i glu len cing rang gi mgor me tog gi phreng ba dor la de nas ji lta ba bzhin bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Then, singing the song of casting the flower, cast the flower garland on one’s own head, and then bind it as appropriate.

original: de nas dngos grub kyi brtul zhugs bzung ba'i bar gyis chog rnams rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: de nas dngos grub kyi brtul zhugs bzung ba'i bar gyis chog rnams rjes su spyad la /
translated: Then, having performed the ritual up to the taking of the vow of spiritual practice for spiritual powers,

original: dkyil 'khor der rang gi snying ga'am zla bar yid kyis gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der rang gi snying ga'am zla bar yid kyis gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should mentally enter that maṇḍala at one’s heart or moon.

original: de nas rdo rje 'bar ba'i lcags kyu chen po dang / h'um gis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba snga ma bzhin du rang gi lus la bcug la de nas snga ma bzhin du 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bskyed de bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'bar ba'i lcags kyu chen po dang / h'um gis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba snga ma bzhin du rang gi lus la bcug la de nas snga ma bzhin du 'od kyi dkyil 'khor bskyed de bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the great blazing vajra hook and hūṃ, one should enter the body of the Bhagavat Vajra-like-flame as before. Then, one should generate the maṇḍala of light as before and accomplish it.

original: de nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen por rgyas btab la 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje rigs kyi rnal 'byor chen po byas la dang po'i rdo rje bcings te /
analyzed: de nas chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen por rgyas btab la 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje rigs kyi rnal 'byor chen po byas la dang po'i rdo rje bcings te /
translated: Then, having sealed with the Dharma, Action, and Great Seal, one should perform the great yoga of the Vajra family, such as the Noble Compendium of Principles, and so on, and bind the original vajra.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: One should bless oneself with Vajrasattva and so on as before.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad du yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad du yi ge h'um gis byin gyis brlabs par bya'o //
translated: One should bless with the syllable hūṃ the vajra hūṃkāra.

original: de nas yi ge brgya pas brtan par byas la sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan gyis dbang bskur pa'i phyag rgya'am /
analyzed: de nas yi ge brgya pas brtan par byas la sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan gyis dbang bskur pa'i phyag rgya'am /
translated: Then, one should stabilize with the hundred syllable mantra and confer empowerment with the mudra of the empowerment conferred by the diadem of the five buddhas.

original: rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas bdag nyid dbang bskur la yi ge gnyis kyi go chas go bgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas bdag nyid dbang bskur la yi ge gnyis kyi go chas go bgo bar bya'o //
translated: Or, one should confer empowerment on oneself with the mudra of conferring empowerment in the Vajravali and one should don the armor with the two syllables.

original: de nas rdo rje dang bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba blangs nas dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs bzung nas //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje dang bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba blangs nas dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs bzung nas //
translated: Then, having taken the empowerment of the vajra, the master, and the name, one should take up the spiritual practice of the vajra of spiritual powers.

original: bro bo'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis yang dag par mchod la bcom ldan 'das la khro gnyer 'dzum pa dang bcas pas btud par byas la phyag bzhi byas la /
analyzed: bro bo'i rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis yang dag par mchod la bcom ldan 'das la khro gnyer 'dzum pa dang bcas pas btud par byas la phyag bzhi byas la /
translated: Then, having made offerings with the twelve offerings of mudra such as the vajra dance and so forth, one should bow to the Bhagavat with a smiling frown and perform four prostrations.

original: de'i rjes la de kho na nyid kyis rdo rje bzung @298b zhing chos kyi dril bu dkrol la dam tshig gi phyag rgya chen por byin gyis brlabs nas h'um lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la de kho na nyid kyis rdo rje bzung @298b zhing chos kyi dril bu dkrol la dam tshig gi phyag rgya chen por byin gyis brlabs nas h'um lan gsum bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, having held the vajra of reality, rung the bell of reality, and blessed the great pledge seal, one should recite the three syllable mantra.

original: de'i rjes la aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de'i rjes la aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /
translated: After that, say oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ.🔽

original: zhes bya bas lha thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rjer bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas lha thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rjer bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should meditate on oneself as the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the deities by reciting OṂ Vajra ĀTMAKO ’Ham.

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham zhes zlos shing gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhing stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham zhes zlos shing gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhing stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting OṂ SVABHĀVA ŚUDDHÔ ’Ham, one should meditate on oneself as having the nature of emptiness, like a reflection.

original: de nas sarba sa mo& ham zhes zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis thabs dang shes rab kyi 'thas bu lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sarba sa mo& ham zhes zlos shing chos thams cad bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis thabs dang shes rab kyi 'thas bu lha thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting SARVA SAMÔ ’Ham, one should meditate on oneself as the nature of all the deities by the sameness of the selflessness of all phenomena, with the union of means and insight.

original: de nas snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba la yid ge h'um yid kyis bris la sarbhodha ma ma h'a he shvarya dhi pa ram /
analyzed: de nas snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba la yid ge h'um yid kyis bris la sarbhodha ma ma h'a he shvarya dhi pa ram /
translated: Then, one should visualize the syllable HŪṂ mentally written on the blazing vajra at the heart, and recite SARVA BODHIMAHA HEŚVARYA DHIPA RAṂ

original: sa ma yo& ham badzra sa tva stvam zhes brjod la /
analyzed: sa ma yo& ham badzra sa tva stvam zhes brjod la /
translated: SAMAYO ’Ham VAJRA SATTVA SATTVAM.

original: nyin re'i sbyor bas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: nyin re'i sbyor bas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: One should recite this daily practice.

original: dkyil 'khor gzhan rnams kyi sngags ni bzlas 'bum bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gzhan rnams kyi sngags ni bzlas 'bum bya'o //
translated: The mantras of the other maṇḍalas should be repeated one hundred thousand times.

original: de ltar sngon du bsnyen pa bya bar 'gyur ro //🔽yang na rang gi snying gar rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la rang rang gi snying pos rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar du rang gi snying ga'i dkyil 'khor du rang
analyzed: de ltar sngon du bsnyen pa bya bar 'gyur ro // yang na rang gi snying gar rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la rang rang gi snying pos rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa nas rdo rje 'bebs pa'i bar du rang gi snying ga'i dkyil 'khor du rang
translated: Thus, one should perform the preliminary practice.

original: rang gi gnas su yid kyis bkod la /
analyzed: rang gi gnas su yid kyis bkod la /
translated: Or else, in one’s heart one should generate the maṇḍala of Vajrānala with the vajra wheel gesture, and with one’s own essence mantra one should mentally arrange in one’s heart maṇḍala Vajrānala and so forth up to Vajrāveśa in their own places.

original: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham /🔽aom sarba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham / aom sarba shuddho& ham /
translated: Reciting “Oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ,”🔽“Oṃ sarva śuddho ’haṃ,”

original: aom sarba sa mo& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba sa mo& ham /
translated: and “Oṃ sarva samāśuddho ’haṃ,”

original: zhes zlos shing snga ma bzhin du don gsum pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes zlos shing snga ma bzhin du don gsum pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the three topics as before.

original: de nas badzra dzva la aa na l'arka a'atma ma h'a mandala sva bha po& ham sva mam zhes bya bas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i nga rgyal gyis bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: de nas badzra dzva la aa na l'arka a'atma ma h'a mandala sva bha po& ham sva mam zhes bya bas rang gi snying gar gnas pa'i rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i nga rgyal gyis bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: Then, with the pride of Vajra-flame-fire-sun-self-great-maṇḍala-svabhāva-ātmako ’ham svāṃ, one should imagine oneself at one’s heart as Vajra-flame-fire-sun.

original: lha thams cad kyi thugs na gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i dbus su yi ge h'um yid kyis bris la /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi thugs na gnas pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i dbus su yi ge h'um yid kyis bris la /
translated: In the middle of the blazing vajra in the heart of all the deities, one should mentally write the syllable hūṃ.

original: de nyid rdo rje'i tshig gam khro bo'i tshig gis zlos shing ji srid dkyil 'khor de nyid nyin re bsgom pa'i dus su mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bzlas brjod dang bsgom pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje'i tshig gam khro bo'i tshig gis zlos shing ji srid dkyil 'khor de nyid nyin re bsgom pa'i dus su mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du bzlas brjod dang bsgom pa bya'o //
translated: Reciting that very vajra word or wrathful word, one should recite and meditate for as long as one sees that very maṇḍala in actuality at the time of daily meditation.

original: de ltar sngon du bsnyen pa legs par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sngon du bsnyen pa legs par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, one will have well performed the preliminary service.

original: de ltar sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas zhag bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa nas brtsams te dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas zhag bdun gyi bar du ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom pa nas brtsams te dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the preliminary service in that way, one should meditate on the maṇḍala for seven days, beginning with the meditation on the three meditative concentrations.

original: de nas nyin re 'am zla re'am /
analyzed: de nas nyin re 'am zla re'am /
translated: Then, every day or every month,

original: @299a * // lo re zhing dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: @299a * // lo re zhing dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala every year.

original: de yang gtsug lag khang ngam /
analyzed: de yang gtsug lag khang ngam /
translated: Moreover, it should be drawn in a temple,

original: kun dga' ra ba'am /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'am /
translated: or in a pleasure grove,

original: grong rdal lam /
analyzed: grong rdal lam /
translated: or in a town,

original: grong khyer ram /
analyzed: grong khyer ram /
translated: or in a city,

original: yul ljongs kyi byang dang / shar gyi mtshams kyi sa'i char bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yul ljongs kyi byang dang / shar gyi mtshams kyi sa'i char bsam par bya'o //
translated: or in a country, in the northern or eastern direction.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs su bris na ;
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi shar phyogs su bris na ;
translated: If it is drawn in the east of the maṇḍala,

original: rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba dang / yul gyi skye po rnams dang 'tshe ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyal po rnam par rgyal ba dang / yul gyi skye po rnams dang 'tshe ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the king will be victorious, and there will be much harm to the people of the country.

original: grong khyer gang gi lho phyogs su bris par gyur na de stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grong khyer gang gi lho phyogs su bris par gyur na de stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is drawn in the south of the city, it will become empty.

original: gang la dmigs nas bris pa de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la dmigs nas bris pa de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever is targeted will die.

original: nub phyogs su bris na /
analyzed: nub phyogs su bris na /
translated: If it is drawn in the west,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi slob /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi slob /
translated: the maṇḍala master

original: dpon 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpon 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will die.

original: byang phyogs su bris na /
analyzed: byang phyogs su bris na /
translated: If it is drawn in the north,

original: der gang zhig zhugs pa de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gang zhig zhugs pa de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the one who enters there will die.

original: me'i mtshams kyi sar bris na /
analyzed: me'i mtshams kyi sar bris na /
translated: If it is drawn in the southeast,

original: char mi 'bab pa dang / me'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char mi 'bab pa dang / me'i 'jigs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there will be no rain and the danger of fire will arise.

original: bden bral du ni bris na /
analyzed: bden bral du ni bris na /
translated: If one draws it in the southwest,

original: mu ge 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu ge 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there will be famine.

original: rlung gi char bris na chu chen po 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gi char bris na chu chen po 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one draws it in the northwest, there will be a great flood.

original: de bas na grong khyer gyi dbang ldan gyi phyogs char brten nas sa yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na grong khyer gyi dbang ldan gyi phyogs char brten nas sa yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should examine the ground in a place that is in the northeast of the city.

original: mchod rten dang nye ba ma yin rlung gi gnas su yang ma yin /🔽mchod rten gyi gnas su ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod rten dang nye ba ma yin rlung gi gnas su yang ma yin / mchod rten gyi gnas su ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not do it near a stupa, nor in a place where there is wind,🔽nor in a place where there is a stupa.

original: shing gi gnas su ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: shing gi gnas su ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: If one does it in a place where there is a tree, one will die.

original: klu'i gnas su 'chi ba dang / chu'i dmu rdzing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu'i gnas su 'chi ba dang / chu'i dmu rdzing 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it in a place where there is a naga, there will be a flood.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i gnas su ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i gnas su ni /
translated: In the place that has been described,

original: rdo ba dang / rus pa dang / gyo mo dang / phub ma dang / sol ba la sogs pa bsal la dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo ba dang / rus pa dang / gyo mo dang / phub ma dang / sol ba la sogs pa bsal la dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the maṇḍala after removing stones, bones, potsherds, chaff, ashes, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir rdo ba dang bcas par ni rlung 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdo ba dang bcas par ni rlung 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if there are stones, there will be wind.

original: rus pa dang bcas par ni gzer gyis 'debs so //
analyzed: rus pa dang bcas par ni gzer gyis 'debs so //
translated: If there are bones, there will be pain.

original: gseg ma dang bcas pa'i gnas su lkugs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gseg ma dang bcas pa'i gnas su lkugs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In a place with gravel, one will become mute.

original: phub ma dang / sol ba dang bcas pa'i gnas su rims 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phub ma dang / sol ba dang bcas pa'i gnas su rims 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In a place with ashes and charcoal, one will contract a fever.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i phyogs kyi cha de'i sa de yang bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs te rigs bzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i phyogs kyi cha de'i sa de yang bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs te rigs bzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: The ground in the directions described above should be known as the four castes: brahmin, warrior, merchant, and laborer.

original: de la dkar po gang yin pa de ni bram ze'i rigs te /
analyzed: de la dkar po gang yin pa de ni bram ze'i rigs te /
translated: The white one is the brahmin caste.

original: sa phyogs der gang rig pa sgrub par byed na bsang phye dang / phreng ba dang / @299b dbyig pa dang / dbyi gu dang / spyi blugs la sogs pa'i rdzas dang / nges der dkyil 'khor bri par bya'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs der gang rig pa sgrub par byed na bsang phye dang / phreng ba dang / @299b dbyig pa dang / dbyi gu dang / spyi blugs la sogs pa'i rdzas dang / nges der dkyil 'khor bri par bya'o //
translated: In that place, one should draw the maṇḍala with substances such as the sacrificial ladle, rosary, staff, water jar, and water vessel, and perform the rite of knowledge.

original: dmar po gang yin pa de ni rgyal rigs te /
analyzed: dmar po gang yin pa de ni rgyal rigs te /
translated: The red one is the warrior caste.

original: gang de sgrub par byed pas na rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / mdung dang / mdung thung dang / mnga'  bo che dang / 'phang mdung dang / lcags mda' la sogs pa sgrub par byed de der des dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang de sgrub par byed pas na rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / ral gri dang / mdung dang / mdung thung dang / mnga'  bo che dang / 'phang mdung dang / lcags mda' la sogs pa sgrub par byed de der des dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw the maṇḍala there, by which one accomplishes the vajra, the discus, the sword, the spear, the javelin, the mace, the lance, the iron arrow, and so forth.

original: ser po gang yin pa de ni rje'u rigs te gang zhig der bsgrubs pas ni dgra sta dang / zhags pa dang / tog spyad la sogs pa bsgrub pa ste des dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o ;
analyzed: ser po gang yin pa de ni rje'u rigs te gang zhig der bsgrubs pas ni dgra sta dang / zhags pa dang / tog spyad la sogs pa bsgrub pa ste des dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o ;
translated: The yellow one is the merchant caste, and one should draw the maṇḍala there by which one accomplishes the axe, the noose, the flag, the goad, and so forth.

original: / nag po gang yin pa de ni dmangs rigs te /
analyzed: / nag po gang yin pa de ni dmangs rigs te /
translated: The black one is the menial caste,

original: sa phyogs gang yin pa der ni cig shos kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs gang yin pa der ni cig shos kyi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: and one should draw the maṇḍala there of the other.

original: tshon sna lnga'i srad bus thig btab la ri mo shin tu mi sbom pa shin tu mi phra ba shin tu mi 'byer pa /
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i srad bus thig btab la ri mo shin tu mi sbom pa shin tu mi phra ba shin tu mi 'byer pa /
translated: One should draw the lines with a string of five colors, neither too thick nor too thin, not interrupted,

original: rgyun mi chad par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi chad par bya'o //
translated: and not broken.

original: de la ri mo phra bas ni za byed kyi las bskyed do //
analyzed: de la ri mo phra bas ni za byed kyi las bskyed do //
translated: There, too thin generates the karma of being eaten by ghosts.

original: sbom pos ni klu'i gnas bskyed do zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs so //
analyzed: sbom pos ni klu'i gnas bskyed do zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang gis gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One Vajradhara has said that the thick one generates the abode of the nāgas.

original: de la dang por re zhig yo byad thams cad dang ldan pas mngon par gang 'dod pa'i sa'i dbus su mi rus kyi phye ma la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs bzlog la bdag dang slob ma zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig yo byad thams cad dang ldan pas mngon par gang 'dod pa'i sa'i dbus su mi rus kyi phye ma la sogs pas dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs bzlog la bdag dang slob ma zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: There, first of all, one who possesses all the articles, in the center of the ground that one desires, having repelled the obstacles of the maṇḍala with bone ash, and so on, one should perform the fire sacrifice of pacifying oneself and the disciples.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis gdug pa rnams bskrad la gnas bsrung ba rnams byas nas yang nyungs kar dang chu dang / thal ba la dkyil 'khor de nyid lan bdun bzlas pas gtor la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis gdug pa rnams bskrad la gnas bsrung ba rnams byas nas yang nyungs kar dang chu dang / thal ba la dkyil 'khor de nyid lan bdun bzlas pas gtor la /
translated: Then, having expelled the evildoers with Vajrayakṣa, and having performed the protection of the site, one should again scatter mustard seed, water, and ash, having enchanted them seven times with that very maṇḍala.

original: sa phyogs der khru gang tsam mam 'dom gang tsam du brkos te zlos la skra dang phub ma dang rus pa dang / gseg ma dang / thal ba dang / sol ba la sogs pa bsal la sbyangs nas spos chu'i dri zhim pos spags pa'i sas bkang ste /
analyzed: sa phyogs der khru gang tsam mam 'dom gang tsam du brkos te zlos la skra dang phub ma dang rus pa dang / gseg ma dang / thal ba dang / sol ba la sogs pa bsal la sbyangs nas spos chu'i dri zhim pos spags pa'i sas bkang ste /
translated: Having dug up that place one cubit or one fathom, having removed the hair, chaff, bones, gravel, ash, charcoal, and so on, having purified it, one should fill it with earth mixed with the fragrant water of incense.

original: rdo rje rtse mo yongs su bzlas pa'i dri'i chus yang dang yang chag chag btab la kun du brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo yongs su bzlas pa'i dri'i chus yang dang yang chag chag btab la kun du brdung bar bya'o //
translated: Having sprinkled it again and again with water perfumed with the perfume of the thoroughly recited Vajra Peak, one should beat it all over.

original: de nas shin tu mnyam par byas pa sgo bzhi dang ldan pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma'i nang du chud ba dang / rta babs bzhi sa mdzes par byas pa phyogs bzhir skar khung bzhes yongs su bskor ba der slob ma shin tu byang bas @300a * //
analyzed: de nas shin tu mnyam par byas pa sgo bzhi dang ldan pa'i khang pa brtsegs ma'i nang du chud ba dang / rta babs bzhi sa mdzes par byas pa phyogs bzhir skar khung bzhes yongs su bskor ba der slob ma shin tu byang bas @300a * //
translated: Then, having made it very even, one should have the apprentice, who is very skilled, plaster the inside of the four-doored mansion with the five products of the cow,

original: ba'i rnam lnga la rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pas shar phyogs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ba'i rnam lnga la rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pas shar phyogs nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from the east, having had it recited with the thoroughly recited Vajrāyasa.

original: skyang nul byed du bcug cing de nyid yongs su bzlas pa'i dri chus bsang gtor byas la de nyid bzlas pa'i rin po che dang / sman dang 'bru thams cad sa'i dbus dang phyogs bzhir dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: skyang nul byed du bcug cing de nyid yongs su bzlas pa'i dri chus bsang gtor byas la de nyid bzlas pa'i rin po che dang / sman dang 'bru thams cad sa'i dbus dang phyogs bzhir dgug par bya'o //
translated: Having sprinkled it with water perfumed with the perfume of the thoroughly recited [mantra], one should summon all the jewels, herbs, and grains, which are also thoroughly recited, to the center of the ground and the four directions.

original: sa gzhi yongs su spyang ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi yongs su spyang ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of purifying the ground.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa shin tu byi dor byas pa'i char rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bskrad la yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba la de nyid yongs su bzlas pas sa la gtor nas yang slob ma shin tu byang bas rdo rje gnod sbyin bzlas pa'i
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa shin tu byi dor byas pa'i char rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bskrad la yungs kar dang chu dang thal ba la de nyid yongs su bzlas pas sa la gtor nas yang slob ma shin tu byang bas rdo rje gnod sbyin bzlas pa'i
translated: Having driven out the obstructors with Vajrayakṣa on a very well-polished wall, etc., having scattered mustard seed, water, and ashes, completely enchanted with that [mantra], one should again enchant the disciple with Vajrayakṣa.

original: ba'i rnam lngas shar phyogs nas brtsams te byug par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i rnam lngas shar phyogs nas brtsams te byug par bya'o //
translated: Having enchanted the five products of the cow with Vajrayakṣa, one should anoint [the place] with the five products of the cow, beginning in the east.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i dri'i chus gtor bar byas la de nyid bzlas pa'i rin po che dang sman dang 'bru rnams snga ma bzhin du bcug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i dri'i chus gtor bar byas la de nyid bzlas pa'i rin po che dang sman dang 'bru rnams snga ma bzhin du bcug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having scattered water enchanted with Vajrayakṣa, one should place jewels, medicine, and grain enchanted with that [mantra], as before.

original: de nas yang slob ma shin tu byang bas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i sbos chus shar phyogs nas brtsams te byung tu gzhug go //
analyzed: de nas yang slob ma shin tu byang bas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i sbos chus shar phyogs nas brtsams te byung tu gzhug go //
translated: Then, having enchanted the disciple with Vajrayakṣa, one should have him enter, beginning in the east.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang rig pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sku gzugs lugs ma'am /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang rig pa'i lha mo rnams kyi sku gzugs lugs ma'am /
translated: Then, having made a painting of the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and knowledge goddesses,

original: 'bur du brkos pa'am /🔽byas pa dang / bris pa rnams kyis brgyan par bya ba dang / mtha' mar tshon gyi phreng bas nye bar mdzes par byas la dril bu btags pa'i tog bzang po dang / bla re dang / 'phan gdugs mchog gi sa rnam par brgyan pa dra ba dang /
analyzed: 'bur du brkos pa'am / byas pa dang / bris pa rnams kyis brgyan par bya ba dang / mtha' mar tshon gyi phreng bas nye bar mdzes par byas la dril bu btags pa'i tog bzang po dang / bla re dang / 'phan gdugs mchog gi sa rnam par brgyan pa dra ba dang /
translated: It should be adorned with raised carvings,

original: dra ba phyed pa dang / rdo rje rin po che dang / dar dang / rnga yab dang / me tog gi chun 'phyang dang / gos sna tshogs dang / phreng ba dang / mar me la sogs pas shin tu mdzes par byas la mtshams bzhir gnas pa'i spos snod las bdug pa gtul ba dang /
analyzed: dra ba phyed pa dang / rdo rje rin po che dang / dar dang / rnga yab dang / me tog gi chun 'phyang dang / gos sna tshogs dang / phreng ba dang / mar me la sogs pas shin tu mdzes par byas la mtshams bzhir gnas pa'i spos snod las bdug pa gtul ba dang /
translated: or with paintings, and at the end it should be beautified with garlands of colors. It should be adorned with the best of bells, canopies, and banners, with nets and half-nets, with vajra-gems, silk, yak-tail fans, flower garlands, various cloths, garlands, lamps, and so forth. It should be made very beautiful. In the four corners, incense should be burned from incense burners.

original: phyi rol du glu dang / gar la sogs pa byed du bcug pas kyang yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: phyi rol du glu dang / gar la sogs pa byed du bcug pas kyang yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Outside, one should have singing, dancing, and so forth performed.

original: sa la lag pa gzhag ste yi ge h'um dang / yi ge brgya pa lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sa la lag pa gzhag ste yi ge h'um dang / yi ge brgya pa lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Placing one's hands on the ground, one should recite the syllable hūṃ and the hundred-syllable mantra seven times.

original: sa yongs su gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sa yongs su gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for taking possession of the ground.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug la rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i khro bor snyoms par zhugs pas blangs @300b la bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa byas nas mchod pa rnams pa lnga dang / mchod yon dang las thams cad pa'i spos chu la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug la rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i khro bor snyoms par zhugs pas blangs @300b la bgegs gzhom pa la sogs pa byas nas mchod pa rnams pa lnga dang / mchod yon dang las thams cad pa'i spos chu la /
translated: Then, sitting in the center of the maṇḍala site, one should take it with the wrathful one blazing like a vajra fire, and having subjugated the obstructors, and so on, one should offer the five offerings, the water for the feet, and the water for the mouth, and having completely recited the mantra, one should emanate the great maṇḍala of Vajra-Blaze with the mudra of the vajra wheel.

original: sngags yongs su bzlas la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por mngon par sprul la phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sngom pa bzung nas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i sbyor bas rnal 'byor pas de
analyzed: sngags yongs su bzlas la rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por mngon par sprul la phyag bya ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sngom pa bzung nas rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i sbyor bas rnal 'byor pas de
translated: Having taken the vows with the preliminary of homage, and so on, the practitioner should accomplish it with the yoga of Vajra-Blaze.

original: bzhin bsgrubs nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: bzhin bsgrubs nas cho ga thams cad rjes su spyad la /
translated: Having performed all the rites,

original: de nyid kyis ni rdo rje gzung //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni rdo rje gzung //
translated: one should hold the vajra

original: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //🔽dam tshig gis ni phyag rgya cher //
analyzed: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya // dam tshig gis ni phyag rgya cher //
translated: and ring the bell of the Dharma.🔽Having blessed the great mudra with the pledge,

original: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
translated: one should recite the essence.

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /
translated: After that,

original: g-yon pa'i mig tu ta las zla ba bya //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i mig tu ta las zla ba bya //
translated: In the left eye, from ta, a moon.

original: g-yas par ma bkod nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed //
analyzed: g-yas par ma bkod nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed //
translated: In the right, not arranged, a sun maṇḍala is generated.

original: h'um gis mig 'bras bskal ba'i me lta bur //
analyzed: h'um gis mig 'bras bskal ba'i me lta bur //
translated: With hūṃ, the eyeballs are like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: gnas pa 'dis ni rdo rje'i lta ba bya //
analyzed: gnas pa 'dis ni rdo rje'i lta ba bya //
translated: With this, one should do the vajra gaze.

original: zhes bya ba dang h'um zlos pa la brtson zhing yid kyis phyag rgya chen po bcings la bar snang gi phyogs su gnas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang h'um zlos pa la brtson zhing yid kyis phyag rgya chen po bcings la bar snang gi phyogs su gnas te /
translated: Concentrating on the recitation of hūṃ and mentally binding the great seal, one should stand in the direction of space.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i //
translated: From the maṇḍala of wind

original: 'od zer rnon po rnam par 'phro //
analyzed: 'od zer rnon po rnam par 'phro //
translated: sharp light rays radiate

original: dbus su sa bon rnam bkod pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su sa bon rnam bkod pa'o //
translated: and in the center the seed is arranged.

original: rdo rje brtul zhugs can gyis bsam //
analyzed: rdo rje brtul zhugs can gyis bsam //
translated: The one with vajra conduct should imagine

original: ri bo dang bcas sa gzhi rnams dang ni //
analyzed: ri bo dang bcas sa gzhi rnams dang ni //
translated: the earth with its mountains and

original: chu tshogs rdo rje me yi thal bar byas //
analyzed: chu tshogs rdo rje me yi thal bar byas //
translated: the water masses reduced to ashes by vajra fire.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs su kham ni rnam bsams na //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs su kham ni rnam bsams na //
translated: Imagining khaṃ in the direction of space,

original: rnam par snang mdzad chu ni rnam par 'bebs //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chu ni rnam par 'bebs //
translated: the water of Vairocana falls

original: kun nas dpa' rlabs 'khrug par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dpa' rlabs 'khrug par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: and becomes turbulent with waves.

original: rgya mtsho dpag tu med par de rjes 'gyur //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dpag tu med par de rjes 'gyur //
translated: It becomes the ocean, immeasurable.

original: de tshe rgya mtshor me yis bskor ba la //
analyzed: de tshe rgya mtshor me yis bskor ba la //
translated: Then, the ocean is surrounded by fire,

original: padmar yongs su gyur par brtag par bya //
analyzed: padmar yongs su gyur par brtag par bya //
translated: and one should imagine it completely transformed into a lotus.

original: shes rab ces bshad 'dzam bu'i gser mchog can //
analyzed: shes rab ces bshad 'dzam bu'i gser mchog can //
translated: The one called “wisdom” is the supreme gold of Jambu,

original: rus sbal padma'i rtsa bar bsam par bya //
analyzed: rus sbal padma'i rtsa bar bsam par bya //
translated: and one should imagine the tortoise as the root of the lotus.

original: 'dir ni lte ba dag tu phra nyid ni //
analyzed: 'dir ni lte ba dag tu phra nyid ni //
translated: Here, the subtle one at the navel

original: dzambu'i gser du snang ba rnams par bsam //
analyzed: dzambu'i gser du snang ba rnams par bsam //
translated: is imagined as the appearance of Jambu gold.

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kham gi ni //
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad kham gi ni //
translated: Then, Vairocana, in the nature of the syllable kṣa,

original: ngo bo nyid du byon nas lte bar bzhugs //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du byon nas lte bar bzhugs //
translated: arrives and resides in the navel.

original: gcig tu gyur pa de las ri rab ni //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur pa de las ri rab ni //
translated: From that single one, Mount Meru arises,

original: rin chen bzhi yi char ldan yang dag byung //
analyzed: rin chen bzhi yi char ldan yang dag byung //
translated: endowed with the four parts of the four jewels.

original: zhes bya ba dang / h'um sum h'um zhes bya ba las sa bon gyi yi ge las ri rab bskyed par bya ba'o zhes bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / h'um sum h'um zhes bya ba las sa bon gyi yi ge las ri rab bskyed par bya ba'o zhes bsam mo //
translated: And one should imagine that Mount Meru is generated from the seed syllable hūṃ suṃ hūṃ.

original: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal mo brkyang bas sa la reg par @301a * //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du rdo rje thal mo brkyang bas sa la reg par @301a * //
translated: Then, in the same way, one should touch the ground with the extended vajra palms

original: byas la ri rab rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: byas la ri rab rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab po //
translated: and bless Mount Meru as having the nature of vajra.

original: de nas ri rab kyi steng du rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar bar bskyed la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis 'dug la /
analyzed: de nas ri rab kyi steng du rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas rdo rje me ltar 'bar bar bskyed la dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis 'dug la /
translated: Seated in the hero's cross-legged posture in the center of the mandala ground,

original: bdag nyid spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: one should generate enthusiasm,

original: deng du bdag tshe 'bras bu yod //
analyzed: deng du bdag tshe 'bras bu yod //
translated: saying, Today my life bears fruit,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod la /
translated: and so forth.

original: yan lag thams cad kyis phyag byas te /🔽dngos grub 'di ni stsal du gsol //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad kyis phyag byas te / dngos grub 'di ni stsal du gsol //
translated: Having bowed with all limbs,

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do //
translated: one should say, Please grant this spiritual power.

original: de nas yang yan lag thams cad kyis phyag byas la dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog dang las kyi rgyal po mchog bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang yan lag thams cad kyis phyag byas la dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal po mchog dang las kyi rgyal po mchog bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having bowed with all limbs, one should meditate on the first union, the supreme king of mandalas, and the supreme king of actions.

original: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Then, having bound the great seal,

original: h'um zlos pa la brtson zhing dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir /
analyzed: h'um zlos pa la brtson zhing dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir /
translated: one should recite HŪM and strive to draw the mandala,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bdag nyid la gsol bar bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bdag nyid la gsol bar bsam mo //
translated: imagining that all the Ones-Gone-Thus supplicate oneself.

original: sems can kun la rjes ston pas //
analyzed: sems can kun la rjes ston pas //
translated: You show it to all sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan khyod la gsol ba ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan khyod la gsol ba ni //
translated: I supplicate you, Bhagavat.

original: au ttishtha sa ma ya kro dha ni sumbha dzva la badzra /
analyzed: au ttishtha sa ma ya kro dha ni sumbha dzva la badzra /
translated: Uttistha samayakrodha sum-bhajravaja

original: de nas rang gis dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / h'um h'um badzra tishtha ma h'a mandala autp'a da ya zhes zlos shing /
analyzed: de nas rang gis dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang / h'um h'um badzra tishtha ma h'a mandala autp'a da ya zhes zlos shing /
translated: Then, with one’s pledge seal and reciting “Hum hum vajra tistha maha mandala utpadaya,”🔽lift up the great maṇḍala and mentally lift it up into the sky.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po bteg la yid kyis bar snang gis phyogs su bteg la rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid snying ga dang dbral ba dang lkog ma dang spyi bor bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po bteg la yid kyis bar snang gis phyogs su bteg la rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya de nyid snying ga dang dbral ba dang lkog ma dang spyi bor bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Bless oneself with that very pledge seal at the heart, throat, forehead, and crown.

original: yang phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: yang phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Again, form the great seal.

original: kro dha drashti hi zhes bya ba mig gnyis su bkod la /
analyzed: kro dha drashti hi zhes bya ba mig gnyis su bkod la /
translated: With “Krodha dristi hi,” place it at the two eyes.

original: phyag rgyal gnas de bzhin langs //
analyzed: phyag rgyal gnas de bzhin langs //
translated: The seal is placed in those places.

original: kun du rnam par bltas nas ni //
analyzed: kun du rnam par bltas nas ni //
translated: Looking all around,

original: h'um zhes kun du zlos byed cing //
analyzed: h'um zhes kun du zlos byed cing //
translated: recite “Hum” all around

original: bsgyings pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bskor //
analyzed: bsgyings pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bskor //
translated: and circle with a majestic manner.

original: yi ge aa las rkang pa gnyis kyi mthil du sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la /
analyzed: yi ge aa las rkang pa gnyis kyi mthil du sna tshogs rdo rje bsams la /
translated: Visualize a variegated vajra on the soles of both feet from the letter A.

original: rkang mthil nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rkang mthil nas bzung ste /
translated: Beginning from the soles of the feet,

original: ri rab kyi steng nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng nas brtsams te /
translated: starting from the top of Mt. Meru,🔽imagine the area of the mandala ground as far as the firm ground as having the nature of vajras.

original: sa gzhi brtan pa la thug gi bar du dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i cha rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsam zhing khro bo'i lta bas kyang mtshams dang phyogs dang / nam mkha' dang 'og dang dkyil 'khor bcing pa dang / dra ba dang rab dag bya'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi brtan pa la thug gi bar du dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i cha rdo rje'i rang bzhin du bsam zhing khro bo'i lta bas kyang mtshams dang phyogs dang / nam mkha' dang 'og dang dkyil 'khor bcing pa dang / dra ba dang rab dag bya'o //
translated: With the gaze of wrath, one should bind the directions, the intermediate directions, the sky, below, and the center of the mandala with a net.

original: yang h'um zlos shing de bzhin gshegs pa thams @301b cad kyi thugs ka nas phyung ste /
analyzed: yang h'um zlos shing de bzhin gshegs pa thams @301b cad kyi thugs ka nas phyung ste /
translated: Again, reciting hūṃ, one should emerge from the heart of all tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i khro bos 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rdo rje 'bar ba 'khrug cing /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i khro bos 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rdo rje 'bar ba 'khrug cing /
translated: With wrathful Vajrasattva and so forth, the entire world realm is filled with blazing vajras,

original: mi bzad pa'i h'um gi sgra 'jigs pas kun du khengs shing sdong bu can gyi padma'i 'dab ma bzhin du kun nas g-yo bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: mi bzad pa'i h'um gi sgra 'jigs pas kun du khengs shing sdong bu can gyi padma'i 'dab ma bzhin du kun nas g-yo bar byed pa'o ;
translated: shaking with the terrifying sound of hūṃ, and one should cause it to shake all around like the petals of an upright lotus.

original: / rdo rje 'bebs pa'i sbyor bas nam mkha'i phyogs thams cad nas babs la /
analyzed: / rdo rje 'bebs pa'i sbyor bas nam mkha'i phyogs thams cad nas babs la /
translated: With the application of the vajra-summoning, [the disciple] descends from the sky in all directions.

original: gar las byung ba'i me tog gi thal mos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: gar las byung ba'i me tog gi thal mos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod de /
translated: With the flower añjali that arises from dance, he should make offerings to all the tathāgatas.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas 'dug la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas 'dug la /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, he should sit in the posture of the left leg extended.

original: bskal pa'i me'i phung po lta bu'i khro bo'i tshogs byon pas bdud thams cad skrag par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'i me'i phung po lta bu'i khro bo'i tshogs byon pas bdud thams cad skrag par bya'o //
translated: The host of wrathful ones, like a mass of fire at the end of an eon, should frighten all the māras.

original: de nas dga' ba yongs su gyur pa'i lus kyis shar phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dga' ba yongs su gyur pa'i lus kyis shar phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with a body filled with joy, he should go to the east.

original: de nas g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas de nyid du 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas de nyid du 'dug ste /
translated: Then, in the posture of the left leg extended, he should sit there

original: de bzhin du bgegs thams cad bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bgegs thams cad bskrad par bya'o //
translated: and in the same way drive away all obstacles.

original: de nas gnas de nas gnod sbyin gyi 'gros kyis lho phyogs su song la g-yas brkyang ba'i gnas pas 'dug ste de bzhin du bgegs rnams rjes su bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gnas de nas gnod sbyin gyi 'gros kyis lho phyogs su song la g-yas brkyang ba'i gnas pas 'dug ste de bzhin du bgegs rnams rjes su bskrad par bya'o //
translated: Then, from that place, he should go to the south with the gait of a yakṣa, sit in the posture of the right leg extended, and in the same way drive away the obstacles.

original: de nas gnas de nas langs la g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang ba gnyis kyis nub phyogs su song la zlum po'i 'dug stangs bcings te de bzhin du bgegs rnams shin tu bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gnas de nas langs la g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang ba gnyis kyis nub phyogs su song la zlum po'i 'dug stangs bcings te de bzhin du bgegs rnams shin tu bskrad par bya'o //
translated: Then, rising from that position, one should go to the west with the right-extended and left-extended postures, binding the circular posture, and in the same way, one should completely drive out the obstructors.

original: de nas gnas de nas nam mkha'i khams kyi gtos ma lus pa dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bskyod cing rdo rje'i 'gros kyis byang phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gnas de nas nam mkha'i khams kyi gtos ma lus pa dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bskyod cing rdo rje'i 'gros kyis byang phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Then, from that position, one should go to the north with the vajra gait, shaking the entire realm of space, and the entire realm of the world.

original: de nas g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang ba dang sa ga'i 'dug stangs dang / zlum po'i 'dug stangs dang / mthun pa'i rkang stabs te lngas de bzhin du bgegs bskrad par byas nas rdo rje 'gros kyis gnas te /
analyzed: de nas g-yas brkyang ba dang g-yon brkyang ba dang sa ga'i 'dug stangs dang / zlum po'i 'dug stangs dang / mthun pa'i rkang stabs te lngas de bzhin du bgegs bskrad par byas nas rdo rje 'gros kyis gnas te /
translated: Then, with the five postures—the right-extended, left-extended, squatting, circular, and agreeable postures—one should drive out the obstructors in the same way, and with the vajra gait,

original: de nas shar phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: one should go to the east.

original: de ltar stang stabs bzhis bgegs thams cad bcom par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar stang stabs bzhis bgegs thams cad bcom par gyur pa yin no //
translated: In that way, all obstructors are destroyed by the four postures.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dus su ji lta bya ba de bzhin du 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa gzhig pa la yang sbyar @302a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dus su ji lta bya ba de bzhin du 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa gzhig pa la yang sbyar @302a * //
translated: Just as it is done at the time of the maṇḍala, so it is to be applied to the destruction of the machine, etc.

original: bar bya'o // de ltar 'khrul 'khor la sogs pas bcom par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bya'o // de ltar 'khrul 'khor la sogs pas bcom par gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the machine, etc. are destroyed.

original: stang stabs kyi dus 'dir yi ge h'um khro bo'i tshig gis rgyun mi chad par bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: stang stabs kyi dus 'dir yi ge h'um khro bo'i tshig gis rgyun mi chad par bzla bar bya'o //
translated: At the time of the dance, one should continuously recite the mantra of the wrathful syllable hūṃ.

original: de nas sgo dbye ba'i phyag rgyas sgo bzhi phye la gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: de nas sgo dbye ba'i phyag rgyas sgo bzhi phye la gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa /
translated: Then, with the mudrā of opening the door, one should open the four doors and summon the secret maṇḍala with four faces and four hands,

original: rdo rje rgyu'i ngo bo nyid sngags dang phyag rgya dang bcas pa 'dis dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyu'i ngo bo nyid sngags dang phyag rgya dang bcas pa 'dis dgug par bya'o //
translated: the nature of the vajra cause, together with the mantra and mudrā.

original: aom badzra mandala h'um dza: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mdzub mo dang mthe bong gnyis sbyar ba 'di ni rdo rje 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya ste dkyil 'khor dgug pa'o//
analyzed: aom badzra mandala h'um dza: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mdzub mo dang mthe bong gnyis sbyar ba 'di ni rdo rje 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya ste dkyil 'khor dgug pa'o//
translated: Oṃ vajra maṇḍala hūṃ jaḥ. The two vajra fists with the index and thumb fingers joined is called the vajra wheel mudrā. It is for summoning the maṇḍala.

original: da'i rjes la aom badzra tsakra aa dhi tishtha siddhya h'um zhes bya ba phyag rgya dang bcas pa yang dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: da'i rjes la aom badzra tsakra aa dhi tishtha siddhya h'um zhes bya ba phyag rgya dang bcas pa yang dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should consecrate the maṇḍala with the mantra and mudra of Oṃ vajra cakra adhiṣṭhāna siddhya hūṃ.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mgal me'i 'khor lo bskor ba ltar yongs su bskor ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis mgal me'i 'khor lo bskor ba ltar yongs su bskor ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra is to rotate the two vajra fists like a firebrand.

original: de nas seng ldeng gi rdo rje phur ba h'um las mtha' yas dang rnam par rgyal ba dang / sprin sgra dang / gsus po che dang / rgyal ba zhes bya ba stod khro bo la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bur bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas seng ldeng gi rdo rje phur ba h'um las mtha' yas dang rnam par rgyal ba dang / sprin sgra dang / gsus po che dang / rgyal ba zhes bya ba stod khro bo la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa lta bur bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should imagine the stake of the vajra of khadira wood, arisen from hūṃ, as Ananta, Vijaya, Meghaśravas, Mahākuṣmāṇḍa, and Jaya, with an upper body of a wrathful one and a lower body like a single-pointed vajra.

original: de nas tsandan dmar bos byugs shing srad du dmar pos dkris la /
analyzed: de nas tsandan dmar bos byugs shing srad du dmar pos dkris la /
translated: Then, one should anoint it with red sandalwood paste and wrap it with red thread.

original: me tog gi phreng ba dmar po btags te /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba dmar po btags te /
translated: One should tie a red flower garland around it.

original: ham kro dha ya sa ham tri sha ta tri ta ti zhes lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la g-yon pa'i khro bo khu tshur gyis bzung nas /
analyzed: ham kro dha ya sa ham tri sha ta tri ta ti zhes lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la g-yon pa'i khro bo khu tshur gyis bzung nas /
translated: Reciting “haṃ krodhaya sahasra triśata tati” one hundred and eight times, one should hold it with the wrathful left fist.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams bzhir rdo rje tho bas brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams bzhir rdo rje tho bas brdung bar bya'o //
translated: In the four directions of the outer maṇḍala, one should beat with the vajra hammer.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bskrad la bsrung ba byas nas de bzhin du rdo rje khu tshur gyis sgo bcad de /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyis bgegs bskrad la bsrung ba byas nas de bzhin du rdo rje khu tshur gyis sgo bcad de /
translated: Then, having expelled the obstructors with the vajra-yakṣa, having performed the protection, having closed the door with the vajra fist,

original: rdo rje bsrung bas bsrung ba'i lha thams cad yang dag par bsrungs la rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pas bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir sgor bzhag nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags zlos shing slob dpon rang nyid dam grogs dang bcas pas shar phyogs
analyzed: rdo rje bsrung bas bsrung ba'i lha thams cad yang dag par bsrungs la rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i bum pas bsang gtor bya ba'i phyir sgor bzhag nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags zlos shing slob dpon rang nyid dam grogs dang bcas pas shar phyogs
translated: having protected all the deities with the vajra protection, having placed the vase completely suffused with the vajra-yakṣa mantra outside the door for the sake of sprinkling, the master himself or his assistants, reciting the mantra of the vajra-yakṣa,

original: nas brtsams te dkyil 'khor gyis byug par bya'o //
analyzed: nas brtsams te dkyil 'khor gyis byug par bya'o //
translated: should anoint the maṇḍala, beginning from the east.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis lha thams cad kyi gnas su dri zhim pos dkyil 'khor byas la dpal rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa'i snying po lag pa bdugs pa la lan @302b bdun bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis lha thams cad kyi gnas su dri zhim pos dkyil 'khor byas la dpal rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa'i snying po lag pa bdugs pa la lan @302b bdun bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, the master, having made a maṇḍala with sweet scents in the place of all the deities, should fumigate his hands with the essence of Śrī Vajra-jvalanā and so forth, repeating it seven times.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor de rnams su rang rang gi snying po nyid kyis rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa bkod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor de rnams su rang rang gi snying po nyid kyis rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba la sogs pa bkod par bya'o //
translated: Then, in those maṇḍalas, one should arrange the vajra-fierce-fire, etc., with their own essence mantras.

original: de nas de rnams la mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod de /
analyzed: de nas de rnams la mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod de /
translated: Then, one should worship them with the five offerings.

original: de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin nas ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa rin po che dang / sman dang 'bru thams cad dang ldan pa ras sngon po zung gcig gis mgul pa bcings la /
analyzed: de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin nas ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa rin po che dang / sman dang 'bru thams cad dang ldan pa ras sngon po zung gcig gis mgul pa bcings la /
translated: Then, having given the sacrificial cake outside, one should consecrate the victorious vase, which has the characteristics as previously explained, endowed with all jewels, herbs, and grains, with a pair of blue cloths tied around its neck,

original: me tog gi phreng ba btags la /
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba btags la /
translated: with a garland of flowers attached,

original: phyi rol kun du dris byugs pa /
analyzed: phyi rol kun du dris byugs pa /
translated: smeared with perfume all around,

original: me tog gi sil ma gtor ba /
analyzed: me tog gi sil ma gtor ba /
translated: scattered with flower petals,

original: dri zhim po dang ldan pa'i lcug ma btags la lo ma bzang pos kha brgyan pa rdo rje me ltar 'bar bas kyang spros chu cung zad bcug la /
analyzed: dri zhim po dang ldan pa'i lcug ma btags la lo ma bzang pos kha brgyan pa rdo rje me ltar 'bar bas kyang spros chu cung zad bcug la /
translated: and with fragrant twigs attached, and with an excellent leaf for a lid, and also with a little perfumed water, with the vajra-fierce-fire.

original: cho ga 'dis lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'dis lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate it with this rite.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bos mchod yon la lan brgya bzlas la bum pa der rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo h'um las bskyed de /
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bos mchod yon la lan brgya bzlas la bum pa der rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo h'um las bskyed de /
translated: Having recited the Vajra-Yaksini mantra one hundred times over the water for sprinkling, one should generate Vajra-Yaksini from HŪṀ in that vase.

original: rang gi phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur te /
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgyas dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur te /
translated: Having conferred initiation with one's own seal, the initiation seal,

original: mchod yon phul la mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / khro bo rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi bum pa dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bzung ba'i khro bo rdo rje dang / me tog gi lcag ma la sogs pa rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod yon phul la mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang / khro bo rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pas yang dag par mchod nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi bum pa dam tshig gi phyag rgyas bzung ba'i khro bo rdo rje dang / me tog gi lcag ma la sogs pa rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: having offered water for sprinkling, and having made perfect offerings with the five offerings and with the wrathful Vajra Weapon, etc., one should recite the mantra of Vajra-Yaksini one hundred and eight times, holding the vase of Vajra-Yaksini with the pledge seal of Vajra-Yaksini, with the wrathful Vajra-Flower Whip, etc.

original: de nas me tog rnams bum pa der bcug la rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags nyid kyis bdug sbos dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas me tog rnams bum pa der bcug la rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags nyid kyis bdug sbos dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having placed the flowers in that vase, one should offer incense with the mantra of Vajra-Yaksini itself.

original: de ltar na rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i bum pa de la yang rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi cho ga bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba'i bum pa de la yang rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi cho ga bzla bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should recite the Vajrayakṣa rite over the Vajra-Fire-Like-a-Blazing-Mass-of-Fire jar.

original: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la thun gsum du bzlas brjod de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma gnyis pa la thun gsum du bzlas brjod de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Then, on the second day, one should perform the recitation in three sessions in the same way.

original: bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bum pa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the rite of the consecration of the jar.

original: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang / m'a ma k'is nyin re zhing mar la sogs pa'i sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi khro bo dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar ba dang / m'a ma k'is nyin re zhing mar la sogs pa'i sbyin sreg brgya rtsa brgyad bya ste /
translated: Then, with Vajra-Yakṣa-Wrath, Vajra-Fire-Like-a-Blazing-Mass-of-Fire, and Māmakī, one should perform the burnt offerings of ghee, etc., one hundred and eight times each day.

original: 'di ni bsnyen pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsnyen pa'i sbyin sreg gi cho ga'o //
